49.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! when you marry believing women then divorce them before having touched them, then it is not incumbent on you to count for them the period of (waiting for the next marriage), so provide for them and let them go a good going away. en it is not incumbent on you to count for them the period of (waiting for the next marriage), so provide for them and let them go a good going away.

50.Mir Aneesuddin: O prophet! We have certainly made lawful to you your wives to whom you have given their dowries and those whom your right hand possesses from among the prisoners of war whom Allah has given to you, and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who migrated with you and a believing woman if she gave herself to the prophet, if the prophet (too) intends (to seek) her in marriage, exclusively for you not for the (other) believers, We know what We have appointed for them concerning their wives and those whom their right hands possess, (this is clarified so) that there should not be any blame on you, and Allah is Protectively Forgiving, Merciful.

51.Mir Aneesuddin: You may differ (to invite) whom you will from among them, and you may invite to you whom you will, and there is no sin on you, if you seek (one) of those whom you had (temporarily) set aside (for inviting in future), that is nearer for (providing them with) comfort of their eyes and that they may not grieve and be pleased with that which you give to each one of them; and Allah knows that which is in your hearts and Allah is Knowing, Clement (Kind).

52.Mir Aneesuddin: Women beyond these are not lawful for you, nor (is it lawful) that you should change them for other wives, even if their beauty pleased you, except those whom your right hand possesses, and Allah is Vigilant over everything.

53.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! do not enter the houses of the prophet unless permission is given to you, do not wait for a meal (inside the house) till the time it is cooked, but enter when you are invited and when you have (finished) taking the meal then disperse and do not seek to get involved in conversation, that certainly annoys the prophet but he feels shy of you (to ask you to go) while Allah does not feel shy of the truth. And when you ask the (ladies) for anything, then ask them from behind a curtain, that is cleaner for your hearts and their hearts. And it does not befit you to annoy the messenger of Allah, nor is it (permissible to you) that you should ever marry his wives after him, that is certainly a great (sin) in the sight of Allah.

54.Mir Aneesuddin: Whether you make anything manifest or keep it a secret, Allah is certainly the Knower of everything.

55.Mir Aneesuddin: It is no sin for the ladies( to move freely) among their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers’ sons or their sisters’ sons or their own women or whom their right hands possess, but fear Allah, Allah is certainly a Witness over everything.

56.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah and His angels certainly shower mercy on the prophet, O you who believe! you (too) submissively ask for mercy and peace (to be showered) on him.

57.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who annoy Allah and His messenger, Allah has certainly cursed them in the world and the hereafter and He has prepared a disgraceful punishment for them.

58.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who annoy the believing men and the believing women without their having earned (it), then they indeed bear (the burden of) a false charge and a clear sin.

59.Mir Aneesuddin: O prophet! say to your wives and your daughters and the women among the believers to draw close over themselves (something in the form) of their over garments, that will be better for their being recognized so that they may not be annoyed, and Allah is Protectively, Forgiving, Merciful.

60.Mir Aneesuddin: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease and those who spread rumors in the city do not desist, We will definitely make you to be after them, then they will not be your neighbors in it, except (for) a little while,

61.Mir Aneesuddin: accursed, wherever they are found they will be caught and killed by being murdered.

62.Mir Aneesuddin: That was the procedure of Allah in (the case of) those who passed away earlier, and you will never find a change in the procedure of Allah.

63.Mir Aneesuddin: People ask you about the hour of doom, say, “The knowledge about it is only with Allah, and what will make you understand, perhaps the hour of doom is near.”

64.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah has certainly cursed the infidels and has prepared a blazing fire for them,

65.Mir Aneesuddin: in which they will remain for ever. They will find neither a guardian nor a helper.

66.Mir Aneesuddin: The day their faces will be turned in the fire, they will say, “O would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the messenger.”

67.Mir Aneesuddin: And they will say, “Our Fosterer! We certainly obeyed our leaders and our great men so they misled us from the way.

68.Mir Aneesuddin: Our Fosterer! give them double the punishment and curse them with a great curse.”

69.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! do not be like those who annoyed Musa, so Allah made him free from that which they said, and he was honorable in the sight of Allah.

70.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! fear Allah and make statements to the point.

71.Mir Aneesuddin: He will set right for you your deeds and protectively forgive you your sins, and he who obeys Allah and His messenger, he indeed has achieved a great achievement.

72.Mir Aneesuddin: We certainly offered the trust (probably the power of decision to obey or not to obey the orders of Allah) to the skies and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to bear it and became afraid of it, and man (undertook the responsibility of) bearing it (but) he was certainly unjust, ignorant,

73.Mir Aneesuddin: so Allah will punish the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women and the polytheist men and the polytheist women, and Allah will turn (mercifully) to the believing men and the believing women and Allah is Protectively Forgiving, Merciful.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Praise is due only for Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the skies and whatever is in the earth. And in the hereafter (too) praise will be due only for Him and He is the Wise, the Informed.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: He knows that which enters into the earth and that which comes out of it and that which comes down from the sky and that which goes up into it, and He is the Merciful, the Protectively Forgiving.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who do not believe say, “The hour of doom will not come upon us,” Say, “Why not? By my Fosterer, it will definitely come upon you.”(He is) the Knower of the unseen, not (even) the weight of a particle in the skies or in the earth, nor (something) less than that or greater, is hidden from Him but (it is recorded) in a clear record

4.Mir Aneesuddin: that He may reward those who believe and do righteous works, those are the persons for whom is protective forgiveness and an honorable provision.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who strive against Our signs to frustrate them, those are the persons for whom there is a punishment of painfully weakening uneasiness.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who are given knowledge see, that what is sent down to you from your Fosterer is the truth and it guides to the path of the Mighty, the Praised.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who do not believe say, “Should we show you a man who informs you that when you are scattered a total scattering (after death), you will be in a new creation?

8.Mir Aneesuddin: He has forged a lie against Allah or he is under the influence of a jinn.” No, those who do not believe in the hereafter are (involved) in the punishment, and in error they are far away (from the right path).

9.Mir Aneesuddin: Did they not then consider that which is before them (future) and that which is behind them (past) of the sky and the earth? If We will We can cause the earth to sink with them or We can drop on them pieces from the sky. Certainly there is a sign in that for every servant who turns in repentance (to Allah).

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And indeed We had given to Dawood grace from Us (ordering): O mountains! echo with him (Allah’s praise) and the birds (too), and We made the iron soft for him

11.Mir Aneesuddin: so as to make coats of mail, and measure the links therein, and do righteous work, I am certainly a Seer of what you do.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: And (We made) the wind (to be under the control) of Sulaiman. Its morning (journey was equal to the journey of) a month and its evening (journey was equal to the journey of) a month and We made a fountain of copper to flow for him (probably in the form of a volcanic eruption) and from among the jinn (We gave him those) who worked before him by the order of his Fosterer, and whoever from among them deviated from Our command, We made him taste (something) from the punishment of blazing fire.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: They made for him what he willed, of the fortresses and images and bowls like reservoirs and fixed cooking pots. Work! family of Dawood, being grateful and few of My servants are grateful.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: Then when We decreed death for him, nothing indicated his death to them except a moving creature of the earth which ate away his staff, so when he fell down it was made clear to the jinn, that, had they known the unseen they would not have been remained in the disgraceful punishment (even after his death).

15.Mir Aneesuddin: There were indeed a sign for (the people of) Saba in their houses: two gardens on the right and the left, eat of the provision of your Fosterer and be grateful to Him, a good land and a Protectively Forgiving Fosterer.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: But they turned away (being ungrateful), so We sent on them the tremendous flood and in exchange for their two gardens, We gave to them two (other) gardens yielding bitter fruit and tamarisk and few lote trees. tamarisk and few lote trees.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: Thus did We reward them because they were ungrateful. And do We reward (in this manner anyone) but the ungrateful?

18.Mir Aneesuddin: And We had made between them and the towns which We had blessed, easy visibility; and We had apportioned the journey therein: Travel therein by nights and by days, secure.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: But they said, “Our Fosterer! increase the distance between our journeys,” and they were unjust to themselves, so We made them stories and We scattered them a total scattering. Certainly there are signs in that for every patient, grateful one.

20.Mir Aneesuddin: And Iblis (the devil) proved true on them his guess, so they followed him except a party of the believers.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: And he (the devil) has no authority on them, except that (through his instigations to human beings) We (come to ) know (or distinguish) him who believes in the hereafter from him who is in doubt about it, and your Fosterer is a Custodian over everything.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Pray to those besides Allah whom you claim (to be gods or His partners). They do not control (even) the weight of the particle in the skies or in the earth, and they do not have in them both any share, and He does not have among them any helper.”

23.Mir Aneesuddin: And no recommendation will be of benefit with Him, except of him whom He will permit. At that point, when horror will be removed from their hearts, they will say, “What did your Fosterer say?” They will say, “The truth.” And He is the High, the Great.

24.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “ Who provides you from the skies and the earth?” Say, “Allah, and certainly (either) we or you are on guidance or in clear error.”

25.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “You will not question about our crimes neither will we be questioned about what you do.”

26.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Our Fosterer will gather us together then He will Judge between us with truth, and He is the judge, the Knowing.”

27.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Show me those whom you have joined with Him as partners, by no means (are they partners), no it is Allah (Who is), the Mighty, the Wise.”

28.Mir Aneesuddin: And We have sent you as a conveyer of good news and a warner to all mankind, but the majority of human beings does not know.

29.Mir Aneesuddin: And they say, “When will this promise (be fulfilled) if you are truthful?”

30.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “For you is a promised day which you cannot postpone from its (appointed) time nor can you advance (it).”

31.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who do not believe say, “We will never believe in this Quran nor in (those books) which were before it.” And if you could see when the unjust will be made to stand before their Fosterer, one turning to the other in argument. Those who were considered weak will say to those who were considered great, “Had it not been for you, we would have been believers.”

32.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who were considered great will say to those who were considered weak, “Did we turn you away from the guidance after it had come to you? No, you were criminals.”

33.Mir Aneesuddin: And those considered weak will say to those who were considered great, “No, (this happened due to your) planning by night and day, when you commanded us not to believe in Allah and to set up equals with Him.” And they will hide (their) regret when they see the punishment, and We will get the chains tied in the necks of those who did not believe. Will they be rewarded for anything other than that which they used to do?

34.Mir Aneesuddin: And We did not send a warner to any town, but those who led a luxurious life in it said, “We do not believe in that which you are sent with.”

35.Mir Aneesuddin: And they say, “We have more wealth and children than you and we will not be punished.”

36.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “It is my Fosterer Who enlarges the provision for whom He wills and straitens (it for whomever and whenever He wills), but the majority of human beings certainly does not know.”

37.Mir Aneesuddin: Neither your wealth nor your children (are things) through which you (can) come nearer to Us, unless (you are of those) who believe and do righteous work. So those are the persons who will have double the reward because of what they did, and they will be secure in high places.

38.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who strive against Our signs to frustrate them, those will be made to be present in the punishment.

39.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “ (It is) certainly my Fosterer (Who) enlarges the provision for whom He wills and His servants and straitens (it) for him (whenever He wills). And whatever you spend from anything, He replaces it, and He is the Best of providers.

40.Mir Aneesuddin: And on the day He will gather them all together then say to the angels, “Are these the ones who used to worship you?”

41.Mir Aneesuddin: They will say, “Glory be to You, You are our Guardian not they, no, they used to worship the jinn, most of them were believers in them.”

42.Mir Aneesuddin: So on that day you will not be able to benefit or harm each other, and We will say to those who were unjust, “Taste the punishment of the fire which you used to deny.”

43.Mir Aneesuddin: And when Our clear signs are read to them they say, “He is nothing but a man who intends to turn you away from that which your forefathers worshipped.” And they say, “This is nothing but a forged lie.” And those who do not believe say about the truth when it comes to them, “This is nothing but clear magic.” nothing but clear magic.”

44.Mir Aneesuddin: And we did not give them (Meccans) any books which they study nor did We send to them any warner before you.

45.Mir Aneesuddin: And those before them denied, and these have not reached the tenth of that which We gave to them, yet they denied Our messengers so how was My rejection (of them)!

46.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “ I admonish you only for one thing, that you stand in pairs and singly for the sake of Allah then reflect, your companion is not under the influence of a jinn, he is only a warner (sent) to you before a severe punishment.”

47.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “I do not ask you for a reward, but ( that which I ask you to do) is for your (benefit, the responsibility of) rewarding me (rests on none) but Allah and He is a Witness over everything.”

48.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “My Fosterer certainly strikes through the truth, Great Knower of the unseen.”

49.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “The truth has come and nothing is originated or reproduced by falsehood.”

50.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “ If I err, I err only against my own soul and if I am guided then it is because of that which my Fosterer has communicated to me, He is certainly Hearing, Near.”

51.Mir Aneesuddin: And if you could only see when they are horrified, then there will be no escape, and they will be caught from a near place.

52.Mir Aneesuddin: And they will say, “We believe in it.” But how can they seek (to believe) from such a distant place,

53.Mir Aneesuddin: when they did not believe init earlier? And they strike (guesses) regarding the unseen, from a distance place,

54.Mir Aneesuddin: And a barrier will be placed between them and that which they desire, as was done with the parties (like) them earlier, they certainly used to be in doubt causing restlessness.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Praise is due only for Allah the Initiator of creation of the skies and the earth, Maker of the angels messengers, possessors of wings (forces) two and three and four, He increases in the creation what He wills, Allah certainly has power over everything.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: That which Allah opens for mankind from (His) mercy, there is no withholder for it, and that which He withholds, there is no releaser for it other than Him, and He is the Mighty the Wise.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: O mankind! remember the favor of Allah on you. Is there a creator other than Allah who provides you from the sky and the earth? There is no god except Him, then how are you turned away (form the truth)?

4.Mir Aneesuddin: And if you are denied, then messengers before you were indeed denied, and (all) the affairs are returned to Allah.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: O mankind! Allah’s promise is certainly true, so do not let the life of this world deceive you and do not let the deceiver (devil) deceive you about Allah.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: The devil is certainly your enemy, so take him as an enemy, he invites his party (with the sole purpose) that they should be among the inhabitants of the blazing fire.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: For those who do not believe there is a severe punishment, and those who believe and do righteous works, for them there is protective forgiveness and a great reward.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: Then, is he to whom the evil of his deed is made fair seeming, so that he sees it (as) good, (like one, who is really good)? So Allah certainly leaves to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let your soul waste away regretting over them. Allah is certainly the Knower of the work they do. e, who is really good)? So Allah certainly leaves to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let your soul waste away regretting over them. Allah is certainly the Knower of the work they do.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: And it is Allah Who sends the winds, so that they raise the cloud, then We drive it to a dead land and We give life through it to the earth after its death. (your) resurrection will (also) be like that.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: Whoever intends to be might then (let him know that) the mighty is totally Allah’s. To Him ascend the good statements and He elevates the righteous work. And those who plan evil deeds, for them there is a severe punishment and the planning of those will be lost.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: And Allah created you from the soil then from the sperm, then He made you pairs, and no female carries or lays down but with His knowledge. And nothing is lengthened in life nor anything is reduced from one’s life, but (the length of life is written) in a record. This is certainly easy for Allah.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: And the two seas are not equal, one quenches thirst, sweet, pleasant to drink and the other saltish, bitter; and from each you eat fresh flesh and take out ornaments which you wear; and you see the ships cleave through it that you may seek of His grace and that you may be grateful.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: He makes the night to enter into the day and He makes the day to enter into the night and He compelled the sun and the moon (to follow His laws), each moves fast for an appointed term. That is Allah your Fosterer, His is the kingdom. And those whom you pray to, besides Him, do not own (even) the white spot on a date stone.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: If you call them they will not hear your call, and even if they could hear they will not respond to you, and on the day of resurrection they will reject your (associating them as) partners (with Allah), and none can give you news like the One Informed.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: O Mankind! you are the ones who are in need of Allah while Allah is Independent, the Praised.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: If He wills He can remove you and bring in a new creation,

17.Mir Aneesuddin: and that is not a mighty (thing) for Allah.

18.Mir Aneesuddin: And a bearer of burden will not bear the burden of another (person) and if one heavy with burden calls (someone) for carrying it, none will carry anything of it even though he be a relative. You can warn only those who fear their Fosterer unseen and establish worship (salat). And whoever purifies himself, he purifies himself only for (the benefit of) his own soul and towards Allah is the destination.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: And the blind and the seeing are not equal,

20.Mir Aneesuddin: nor the darkness and the light,

21.Mir Aneesuddin: nor the shade and the heat.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: And the living and the dead are not equal. Allah certainly makes to listen, whom He wills and you cannot make to listen, those who are in the graves.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: You are nothing but a warner.

24.Mir Aneesuddin: We have certainly sent you with the truth as a conveyer of good news and a warner and there has been no community but a warner has passed among them.

25.Mir Aneesuddin: And if you are denied by them, then those before them (also) denied. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and with scriptures and with the book giving light.

26.Mir Aneesuddin: Then I caught those who rejected. So how was My rejection (of them)?

27.Mir Aneesuddin: Did you not see that Allah sends down the water from the sky, then We bring out fruits of different colors? And in the mountains there are white and red layers, (and others) of different colors and (still others) intensely black.

28.Mir Aneesuddin: And among mankind and (other) living beings and the cattle (too), their colors are different likewise. Only those among His servants fear Allah who have knowledge. Allah is certainly Mighty, Protectively Forgiving.

29.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who read (to follow) the book of Allah and establish worship (salat) and spend secretly and openly from that which We have provided them, they certainly hope for a commerce (in which) there will never be a loss,

30.Mir Aneesuddin: because He will repay them in full their rewards and give them more out of His grace. He is certainly Protectively Forgiving, One Who acknowledges.

31.Mir Aneesuddin: And that which we have communicated to you of the books, is the truth confirming (the book) which were before it. Allah is certainly informed of His servants, Seeing (them).

32.Mir Aneesuddin: Then We made those to inherit the book, whom We chose from among Our servants. So among them are those who are unjust to their own souls and among them are those who are moderate and among them are those who are foremost in good deeds by the order of Allah, that is the great grace (of Allah),

33.Mir Aneesuddin: gardens of everlasting bliss which they will enter, they will be made to wear therein bracelets of gold and pearls and their garments therein will be (of) silk.

34.Mir Aneesuddin: And they will say, “Praise is due only for Allah Who has removed grief from us, Our Fosterer is certainly Protectively Forgiving, One Who acknowledges,

35.Mir Aneesuddin: Who has made us alight in an eternal home out of His grace, neither toil will touch us therein nor will fatigue touch us therein.”

36.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who do not believe, for them is the fire of hell, it will neither bring the end of them that they may die, nor (something) of its punishment be lightened on them, thus will We reward every infidel.

37.Mir Aneesuddin: And therein they will cry for help, “Our Fosterer! take us out, we will do righteous work, other than that which we used to do.” (They will be answered). “ Did We not keep you alive to the extent that he who wanted to be mindful in it could have been mindful? And the warner (too) came to you, so taste (the penalty), and for those who are unjust there is no helper.”

38.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah is certainly the Knower of the unseen of the skies and the earth, He is certainly the Knower of that which is in the bosoms.

39.Mir Aneesuddin: He it is Who has made you successors in the earth. So he who does not believe, on him is (the responsibility of) his infidelity, and their infidelity does not increase for the infidels, in the sight of their Fosterer, anything but hatred, and their infidelity does not increase for the infidels anything but loss.

40.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Have you considered your (presumed) partners (of Allah) whom you pray to, besides Allah? Show me what they have created from the earth or is there a partnership for them in the skies?” Or have We given them a book so that they are on a clear proof from it. No, the unjust do not promise each other but to decevice.

41.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah certainly holds together the skies and the earth lest they get separated and if they get separated, no one other than Him can hold both of them together. He is certainly Clement, Protectively Forgiving.

42.Mir Aneesuddin: And they swore by Allah the strongest of their oaths, that if a warner came to them they would definitely be better guided than any of the (other) communities, but when a warner came to them, it did not increase in them anything but hatred.

43.Mir Aneesuddin: They consider themselves great in the earth and plan evil, and the evil plan does not engulf anyone except the authers of it. So do they wait for anything, except the procedure (in which) the ancients (were treated)? Then you will never find a change in the procedure of Allah and you will never find an alteration in the procedure of Allah.

44.Mir Aneesuddin: Did they not travel in the earth and see how the end of those before them was (brought about)? And they were severer than them in strength. And Allah is not such that anything in the skies or in the earth could frustrate Him. He is certainly Knowing, Powerful.

45.Mir Aneesuddin: And if Allah were to catch human beings for that which they earned (of sin), He would not have left on the surface of the (earth, any) of the moving creatures, but He gives them time till an appointed term, but when their term comes (to an end, He will catch them) because Allah is certainly One Who sees His servants.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Yaa Siin.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: By the Quran full of wisdom,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: you are certainly (one) of the messengers,

4.Mir Aneesuddin: on the straight path.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: (The Quran is) sent down by the Mighty, the Merciful

6.Mir Aneesuddin: that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned so they are heedless.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: The word has indeed proved true on most of them so they do not believe.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: We have placed chains round their necks and they are right up to the chins, so their heads are raised,

9.Mir Aneesuddin: and We have made a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, then We have covered them, therefore they are not able to see.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And it is equal to them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they will not believe.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: You can warn only him who follows the reminder and fears the Beneficent (Allah) without having seen Him, so convey to him the good news of protective forgiveness and an honourable reward.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: We certainly give life to the dead and record the (deeds) which they send before (in advance) and their footprints (work which they leave behind) and We have computed everything in a clear guide (book of deeds).

13.Mir Aneesuddin: And set forth to them the similitude of the inhabitants of the town, when messengers came to it,

14.Mir Aneesuddin: when We sent to them two, they denied them both, therefore We strengthened (them) with a third, so they said, “We are messengers (sent) to you.”

15.Mir Aneesuddin: They said, “You are nothing but men like us and the Beneficent (Allah) has not sent down anything, you do nothing but lie.”

16.Mir Aneesuddin: They said, “Our Fosterer knows that we are certainly messengers (sent) to you

17.Mir Aneesuddin: and there is no (responsibility) on us except clear conveyance (of the message).”

18.Mir Aneesuddin: They said, “We consider you to be an evil omen, if you do not desist we will definitely stone you and you will definitely be afflicted by a painful punishment from us.”

19.Mir Aneesuddin: They said, “(Let) your evil omens be with you. What! (you resist us just) because you are reminded, no, you are an extravagant people.”

20.Mir Aneesuddin: And a man came running from a distant (part) of the city, he said, “O my people! follow the messengers,

21.Mir Aneesuddin: follow those who do not ask you for a reward and who are themselves guided.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: And what reason do I have not to serve Him Who initiated my creation, and to Him you will be returned.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: What! should I take gods besides Him, whose recommendation will not make me free from anything, if the Beneficent (Allah) intends harm, nor will they save me?

24.Mir Aneesuddin: Then, in that case, I will certainly be in clear error.

25.Mir Aneesuddin: I have believed in your Fosterer, so listen to me.”

26.Mir Aneesuddin: It was said, “Enter the garden.” He said, “I wish my people could know

27.Mir Aneesuddin: (the reason) because of which my Fosterer protectively forgave me and placed me among the honoured ones.”

28.Mir Aneesuddin: And after him, We did not send down on his people, any army from the sky, and it was not (necessary) for Us to send,

29.Mir Aneesuddin: it was nothing but a single loud cry when they became motionless.

30.Mir Aneesuddin: (Let there be) regret on My servants, there does not come to them any messenger but they mock at him.

31.Mir Aneesuddin: Did they not consider, how many of the generations did We destroy before them which do not come back to them?

32.Mir Aneesuddin: And all of them, without exception, will be presented before Us.

33.Mir Aneesuddin: And a sign to them is the dead earth, We give life to it and bring out from it grain so they eat of it.

34.Mir Aneesuddin: And We have made therein gardens of date palms and grapes and We have caused the springs to gush forth therein,

35.Mir Aneesuddin: that they may eat of its fruit, and their hands did not make it. Will they not then be grateful?

36.Mir Aneesuddin: Glory be to Him Who created pairs of everything, of that which the earth grows and of themselves and of that which they do not know.

37.Mir Aneesuddin: And a sign for them is the night, We cause the day to slip off from it, when (again) they are in darkness.

38.Mir Aneesuddin: And the sun moves on for the time (and) in the space (appointed for) it. That is the programme of the Mighty, the Knowing.

39.Mir Aneesuddin: And the moon, We have programmed for it stages (in space and time) till it returns like an old dry palm branch.

40.Mir Aneesuddin: Neither it is possible for the sun to catch (up with) the moon, nor can the night outstrip the day and each moves fast in an orbit.

41.Mir Aneesuddin: And a sign for them is that We carried their progeny in the loaded ship.

42.Mir Aneesuddin: And We created for them (vessels) similar to it, on which they ride.

43.Mir Aneesuddin: And if We will We can drown them, then there will be no one (to respond) to their cry for help nor will they be saved,

44.Mir Aneesuddin: but (if this does not happen, it is due to) the mercy from Us and a provision till a time.

45.Mir Aneesuddin: And (they are heedless) when it is said to them, “Guard (yourselves against) that which is before you and that which is behind you that you may be dealt with mercifully.”

46.Mir Aneesuddin: And there does not come to them any sign from the signs of their Fosterer but they turn away from it.

47.Mir Aneesuddin: And when it is said to them, “Spend from that which Allah has provided for you,” those who do not believe say to those who believe, “Should we feed him, whom Allah (Himself) could feed, if He wills? You are in nothing but clear error.”

48.Mir Aneesuddin: And they say, “When will the promise (be fulfilled) if you are truthful?”

49.Mir Aneesuddin: They do not wait for anything but a single loud cry which will take hold of them while they are (involved) in a tussle with each other,

50.Mir Aneesuddin: so that they will neither be able to make a bequest nor will they be able to return to their own people.

51.Mir Aneesuddin: And it will be blown into the trumpet (structure of the universe) when they will rush forth from their graves towards their Fosterer,

52.Mir Aneesuddin: saying, “Sorrowful is our state, who has raised us from our sleeping place? This is what the Beneficent (Allah) had promised and the messengers had spoken the truth.”

53.Mir Aneesuddin: It will be nothing but a single loud cry when all of them will be presented before Us.

54.Mir Aneesuddin: So on that day, no soul will be dealt with unjustly in anything and you will not be rewarded for anything but for that which you used to do.

55.Mir Aneesuddin: On that day, the inhabitants of the garden will certainly be in a joyful occupation,

56.Mir Aneesuddin: they and their mates (will be) in shades, reclining on couches.

57.Mir Aneesuddin: For them there will be fruits and for them (there will be) what they ask for.

58.Mir Aneesuddin: ‘Peace,’ (will be) the word from the Merciful Fosterer.

59.Mir Aneesuddin: (Allah will say), “Separate on this day, O you criminals!

60.Mir Aneesuddin: Had I not enjoined on you, O children of Adam! that you should not serve the devil, (as) he is your open enemy,

61.Mir Aneesuddin: and that you should serve Me, this is the straight path?

62.Mir Aneesuddin: And he had indeed led astray a large group of people from among you, then were you not having sense?

63.Mir Aneesuddin: This is the hell you were threatened with,

64.Mir Aneesuddin: enter it this day, because you did not believe.”

65.Mir Aneesuddin: This day We will put a seal on their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us and their feet will bear witness of that which they used to earn.

66.Mir Aneesuddin: And if We will We could wipe off their eyes, then they would strive for the path, but how will they be able to see?

67.Mir Aneesuddin: And if We will We could transform them in their places, then they would not be able to go forward or to return.

68.Mir Aneesuddin: And he to whom We give a long life, We reverse him in creation (instead of growing he starts decaying). Do they not then understand?

69.Mir Aneesuddin: And We have not taught him (Muhammed) poetry and it is not suitable for him, it is nothing but a reminder and a Quran (that makes things) clear,

70.Mir Aneesuddin: that he who is alive may be warned and the word may be proved true against the infidels.

71.Mir Aneesuddin: Did they not see that We have created the cattle for them, among that which Our hands have done, then they are their masters?

72.Mir Aneesuddin: And We have subdued them for their (use), so among them are (some on) whom they ride and (some) of them they eat.

73.Mir Aneesuddin: And they have (other) benefits in them and drinks. Will they not then be grateful?

74.Mir Aneesuddin: And they have taken gods besides Allah that they may be helped.

75.Mir Aneesuddin: They are not capable of helping them, and they (their false gods, supposed to be a) force for them, will (also) be presented (before Allah).

76.Mir Aneesuddin: So do not let their speech grieve you, We know that which they keep secret and that which they make public.

77.Mir Aneesuddin: H as not man considered that We created him from a sperm* even then he is an open disputant. * See note no. 1 of chapter 16, Verse 4.

78.Mir Aneesuddin: And he strikes a similitude for Us and forgets his own creation, saying, “Who will give life to the bones when they are decomposed?”

79.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “He will give life to them Who produced them the first time and He knows every (kind of) creation.

80.Mir Aneesuddin: He it is Who made the fire for you from the green trees, so that you get your fuel from it.

81.Mir Aneesuddin: Is not He Who created the skies and the earth, able to create the like of them, why not? And He is the Great Creator Who knows.

82.Mir Aneesuddin: His command, when He intends anything, is that He says to it only, ‘Be’, so it is.”

83.Mir Aneesuddin: So glory be to Him in Whose hand is the kingdom of everything and to Him you will be returned.

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Mir Aneesuddin: By those who rank themselves in ranks,

2.Mir Aneesuddin: then those who restrain, restraining

3.Mir Aneesuddin: then those who read a reminder:

4.Mir Aneesuddin: Your God is certainly One,

5.Mir Aneesuddin: Fosterer of the skies and the earth and that which is between them both, Fosterer of the rising places and times of the sun .

6.Mir Aneesuddin: We have certainly adorned the sky of the world with an adornment, the planets

7.Mir Aneesuddin: and (provided) protection from every rebellious devil,

8.Mir Aneesuddin: they cannot listen to the high assembly and they are struck from every side,

9.Mir Aneesuddin: being driven away, and for them there is an everlasting punishment,

10.Mir Aneesuddin: except him who snatches a snatching, then a piercing flame* follows him. * Meteorite which sometimes make a hole in the earth.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: So ask them whether their creation is difficult or (of those others) whom We created, We certainly created them from sticking clay.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: No, you wonder while they mock.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: And when they are reminded they do not mind.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: And when they see a sign they seek to mock.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: And they say, “This is nothing but clear magic.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: What! when we die and become (part of the) soil and bones, will we (then) be raised,

17.Mir Aneesuddin: and our forefathers (too)?”

18.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Yes and you will be humbled.”

19.Mir Aneesuddin: So it will only be a single loud scolding to drive them out, when they will see

20.Mir Aneesuddin: and say, “ Sorrowful is our state, this is the day of judgment.”

21.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be said,) “ This is the day of separation which used to denied by you.”

22.Mir Aneesuddin: Gather those who were unjust and their mates (too), and that which they used to serve (worship)

23.Mir Aneesuddin: besides Allah, then lead them to the path of hell.

24.Mir Aneesuddin: And stop them for they will be questioned,

25.Mir Aneesuddin: “What is the matter with you that you do not help each other?”

26.Mir Aneesuddin: No, they will seek submission on that day,

27.Mir Aneesuddin: and some of them will turn to others questioning each other,

28.Mir Aneesuddin: saying, “You certainly used to come to us from the right (with full force to mislead us).”

29.Mir Aneesuddin: (Others will) say, “No, you (only) did not believe,

30.Mir Aneesuddin: and we had no authority on you, no, you were (yourselves)a rebellious people,

31.Mir Aneesuddin: so the word of our Fosterer has proved true on us, we will certainly taste (the punishment),

32.Mir Aneesuddin: we led you astray because we were ourselves astray.”

33.Mir Aneesuddin: So on that day they will be sharers in the punishment.

34.Mir Aneesuddin: Thus do We deal with the criminals.

35.Mir Aneesuddin: When it was said to them, “There is no god except Allah,” they certainly used to consider themselves great (to accept this).

36.Mir Aneesuddin: And they say, “Shall we give up our gods for the sake of a poet under the influence of the jinn?”

37.Mir Aneesuddin: No, he has come with the truth and confirms the messengers (who had come before him).

38.Mir Aneesuddin: You will certainly taste the painful punishment

39.Mir Aneesuddin: and you will not be rewarded except for that which you used to do,

40.Mir Aneesuddin: except the servants, exclusively of Allah.

41.Mir Aneesuddin: For them there will be a known provision,

42.Mir Aneesuddin: fruits, and they will be honoured

43.Mir Aneesuddin: in gardens of bliss,

44.Mir Aneesuddin: on couches facing each other.

45.Mir Aneesuddin: A cup from a spring (of a drink) will be made to go round among them,

46.Mir Aneesuddin: white, delicious for the drinkers.

47.Mir Aneesuddin: There will be no unconsciousness due to it nor will they be intoxicated by it.

48.Mir Aneesuddin: And with them will be (females) who restrain their gaze, having beautiful eyes

49.Mir Aneesuddin: as if they were protected eggs.

50.Mir Aneesuddin: Then some of them will turn to others questioning,

51.Mir Aneesuddin: a speaker among them will say, “I had a comrade of mine

52.Mir Aneesuddin: who used to say: Are you of those who confirm,

53.Mir Aneesuddin: that when we die and become(part of the) soil and bones, we will indeed be brought for judgment?”

54.Mir Aneesuddin: (Someone will) say, “Would you peep (to see him)?”

55.Mir Aneesuddin: So he will peep, then see him in the midst of hell.

56.Mir Aneesuddin: He will say , “By Allah, you had almost destroyed me,

57.Mir Aneesuddin: and had the favor of my Fosterer not been there, I (too) would have been (with you) among those presented (for punishment).”

58.Mir Aneesuddin: (The inhabitants of the garden will say), “Then is it that we will not die,

59.Mir Aneesuddin: except our first death, and we will not be among those who are punished?

60.Mir Aneesuddin: This certainly is a great achievement.”

61.Mir Aneesuddin: So let those who (wish to) work, work for (something) like this.

62.Mir Aneesuddin: Is this a better entertainment or the tree of Zaqqum?

63.Mir Aneesuddin: We have made it an affliction for those who are unjust.

64.Mir Aneesuddin: It is a tree that comes out from the bottom of the hell.

65.Mir Aneesuddin: Its produce resembles in likeness, the heads of devils.

66.Mir Aneesuddin: So they will eat from it then fill their stomachs with it,

67.Mir Aneesuddin: then they will have a drink of boiling water over that.

68.Mir Aneesuddin: Then their return will be to hell.

69.Mir Aneesuddin: They certainly found their fathers astray,

70.Mir Aneesuddin: so they follow their footsteps, being in haste.

71.Mir Aneesuddin: And the majority of the ancients before them, indeed went astray,

72.Mir Aneesuddin: and We had indeed sent warners among them,

73.Mir Aneesuddin: so see how the end of those warned was (brought about),

74.Mir Aneesuddin: except the servants, exclusively of Allah.

75.Mir Aneesuddin: And Nuh prayed to Us, and We are Excellent Responders,

76.Mir Aneesuddin: so We saved him and his followers from the great distress,

77.Mir Aneesuddin: and We caused his descendants to be of those who survived,

78.Mir Aneesuddin: and We left on him (the responsibility of conveying Our message) among others.

79.Mir Aneesuddin: Peace on Nuh in the worlds.

80.Mir Aneesuddin: Thus do We reward the doers of good.

81.Mir Aneesuddin: He was certainly among Our believing servants.

82.Mir Aneesuddin: Then We drowned the others.

83.Mir Aneesuddin: And Ibrahim was certainly of his sect,

84.Mir Aneesuddin: when he came to his Fosterer with a defect less heart.

85.Mir Aneesuddin: When he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship?

86.Mir Aneesuddin: Do you intend to worship false gods besides Allah?

87.Mir Aneesuddin: So what is your guess about the Fosterer of the worlds?”

88.Mir Aneesuddin: Then he looked (with a searching) look at the stars (probably because his people worshipped the stars too and)

89.Mir Aneesuddin: then he said, “I am certainly sick.”

90.Mir Aneesuddin: So his people turned their backs upon him and went away.

91.Mir Aneesuddin: Then he turned towards their (false) gods and said, “Why do you not eat?

92.Mir Aneesuddin: What is (wrong) with you that you do not speak?”

93.Mir Aneesuddin: So he turned against them striking with his right hand.

94.Mir Aneesuddin: Then they came hastening towards him in confrontation.

95.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “What! do you worship that which you (yourselves) carve,

96.Mir Aneesuddin: while Allah has created you and that which you do?”

97.Mir Aneesuddin: They said, “Build a building (furnace) for him then put him into the fire.”

98.Mir Aneesuddin: So they intended (to lay down) a plot against him but We made them the lower most.

99.Mir Aneesuddin: And he said, “I will certainly go away (from these people) towards my Fosterer, He will guide me.

100.Mir Aneesuddin: My Fosterer! grant me from among the righteous.”

101.Mir Aneesuddin: So We conveyed to him the good news of a gentle son.

102.Mir Aneesuddin: Then when he reached (the age of) striving with him, he said, “O my son! I saw in my sleep (dream) that I am slaying you (as a sacrifice), then see, what do you consider (about it)?” He said. “O My father! do what you have been commanded (to do), if Allah wills, you will find me (to be) of the patient ones.”

103.Mir Aneesuddin: Then, when they both submitted and he (Ibrahim) laid him down on his forehead, (at that moment)

104.Mir Aneesuddin: We called out to him, “O Ibrahim!

105.Mir Aneesuddin: you have proved true the vision (by obeying in reality the order given to you through your dream so you need not sacrifice your son) thus do We reward the doers of good,

106.Mir Aneesuddin: this was nothing but a clear trail.”

107.Mir Aneesuddin: And We ransomed him with a great slaughter (sacrifice of a sheep).

108.Mir Aneesuddin: And We left on him (the responsibility of conveying Our message) among others.

110.Mir Aneesuddin: Thus do We reward the doers of good.

111.Mir Aneesuddin: He was certainly among Our believing servants.

112.Mir Aneesuddin: And We conveyed to him the good news of Ishaq, a prophet, from among the righteous.

113.Mir Aneesuddin: And We showered Our blessings on him and on Ishaq. And among their descendents are those who do good and (also) those who are clearly unjust to their own souls.

114.Mir Aneesuddin: And We bestowed Our favor on Musa and Harun

115.Mir Aneesuddin: and We saved both of them and their people from the great distress

116.Mir Aneesuddin: and We helped them so they were the victors.

117.Mir Aneesuddin: And We gave them the book that made (things) clear

118.Mir Aneesuddin: and We guided them both to the straight path.

119.Mir Aneesuddin: And We left on them both (the responsibility of conveying Our message) among others.

121.Mir Aneesuddin: Thus do We reward the doers of good.

122.Mir Aneesuddin: They both were among Our believing servants.

123.Mir Aneesuddin: And Ilyas was certainly from among the messengers.

124.Mir Aneesuddin: When he said to his people, “Why do you not guard (against evil)?

125.Mir Aneesuddin: Why do you pray to Baal (the false sun god presumed by you) and forsake (Allah) the Best of proportioners?

126.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah is your Fosterer and the Fosterer of your forefathers.”

127.Mir Aneesuddin: But they denied him, so they certainly be presented (for punishment),

128.Mir Aneesuddin: except the servants, exclusively of Allah.

129.Mir Aneesuddin: And We left on him, (the responsibility of conveying Our message) among others.

131.Mir Aneesuddin: Thus do We reward the doers of good.

132.Mir Aneesuddin: He was certainly among Our believing servants.

133.Mir Aneesuddin: And Lut was certainly from among Our messengers,

134.Mir Aneesuddin: when We saved him and his followers all together

135.Mir Aneesuddin: except an old woman (who was) among those who remained behind,

137.Mir Aneesuddin: And you certainly pass by their (ruins) during the day

138.Mir Aneesuddin: and during the night. Do you not then understand?

139.Mir Aneesuddin: And Yunus was certainly from among Our messengers

140.Mir Aneesuddin: when he fled to the loaded ship,

141.Mir Aneesuddin: then drew lots but was among those who were slipped off (from the ship),

142.Mir Aneesuddin: then the fish swallowed him and he was blameworthy.

143.Mir Aneesuddin: And had he not been among those who glorify (Allah),

144.Mir Aneesuddin: he would have remained in its stomach till the day they are raised.

145.Mir Aneesuddin: Then We cast him on the naked shore while he was sick,

146.Mir Aneesuddin: and We caused a tree of gourd to grow over him.

147.Mir Aneesuddin: And We sent him to more than a hundred thousand (people),

148.Mir Aneesuddin: so they believed, therefore We made them enjoy till a time.

149.Mir Aneesuddin: Then ask them, “Are there daughters for your Fosterer and for them sons?

150.Mir Aneesuddin: Or did We create the angels females while they were witnesses?”

151.Mir Aneesuddin: Is it not from their own devised falsehood that they say (that)

152.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah has a son? And they are certainly liars.

153.Mir Aneesuddin: Has He chosen daughters (in preference to) sons?

154.Mir Aneesuddin: What is (wrong) with you, how do you judge?

156.Mir Aneesuddin: Or have you a clear authority?

157.Mir Aneesuddin: Then come with your book if you are truthful.

158.Mir Aneesuddin: And they assign a relationship between Him and the jinn and the jinn know that they will be presented (before Him),

159.Mir Aneesuddin: glorified be Allah (He is far) from that which they describe,

160.Mir Aneesuddin: except the servants, exclusively of Allah.

161.Mir Aneesuddin: So you and that which you serve (worship),

163.Mir Aneesuddin: except him who is to enter hell.

164.Mir Aneesuddin: And there is no one among us, but there is a known place for him,

165.Mir Aneesuddin: and we are certainly those set in ranks

166.Mir Aneesuddin: and we are certainly those who glorify.

168.Mir Aneesuddin: “Had we with us, a reminder of the ancients,

169.Mir Aneesuddin: we would have definitely been servants, exclusively of Allah.”

170.Mir Aneesuddin: But (now) they do not believe in this (Quran), so they will know.

171.Mir Aneesuddin: And Our word has already gone forth in respect of Our servants, the messengers,

172.Mir Aneesuddin: that they will certainly be helped.

173.Mir Aneesuddin: And Our forces, they will be victors.

174.Mir Aneesuddin: So turn away from them till a time,

175.Mir Aneesuddin: and keep seeing them, for they (too) will see.

176.Mir Aneesuddin: Do they seek to hasten on Our punishment?

177.Mir Aneesuddin: But when it comes down in their court, then evil will be the morning of those warned.

178.Mir Aneesuddin: And turn away from them till a time,

179.Mir Aneesuddin: and keep seeing, for they (too) will see.

180.Mir Aneesuddin: Glorified be your Fosterer, Lord of Might, (He is far) from that which they describe,

182.Mir Aneesuddin: and praise is due only for Allah, the Fosterer of the worlds.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Saad. By the Quran that contains admonition.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: No, those who do not believe (consider themselves) among the mighty and are in opposition.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: How many of the generations did We destroy before them, so that they cried out, but that was not the time for escape.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: And they wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves. And the infidels say, “This is a magician, a liar.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: Has he made (all) the gods (into) One God? This is certainly a wonderful thing.”

6.Mir Aneesuddin: And the leaders from among them go away (fast, saying) that, “Walk away (from here), and patiently adhere to your gods, this is certainly the thing that is intended.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: We have not heard of this among other communities, this is nothing but something invented (by him).

8.Mir Aneesuddin: Has the reminder been sent down on him of (all the persons) among us?” No, they are in doubt about My reminder, no, they have not yet tasted My punishment.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: Or are there with them, the treasures of the mercy of your Fosterer, the Mighty, the One Who grants?

10.Mir Aneesuddin: Or is the kingdom of the skies and the earth and that which is between them, theirs? Then let them rise into the ways (of the sky).

11.Mir Aneesuddin: There! (among them is) an army of the parties which will be defeated.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: Before them the people of Nuh and Aad and Firawn, the possessor of pegs (of his kingdom firmly established), denied.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: And Samood and people of Lut and the inhabitants of the jungle, those (too) were the parties (defeated earlier).

14.Mir Aneesuddin: There was not one (of them) who did not deny the messengers, so (they became) deserving of My retributional (punishment).

15.Mir Aneesuddin: And they do not wait for anything but a single loud cry, for which there will be no pause.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: And they say, “Our Fosterer! hasten on to us our portion before the day of account.”

17.Mir Aneesuddin: Be patient on that which they say. And remember Our servant Dawood the possessor of power, he was certainly one turning (repentantly to Allah).

18.Mir Aneesuddin: We had certainly subjected the mountains to glorify (Allah) with him in the evening and at sun rise.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: And the birds gathered, all returning to him.

20.Mir Aneesuddin: And We made his kingdom strong and We gave him wisdom and (the power of) decision of affairs.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: And has the news of the disputants come to you, when they climbed the wall of the private chamber,

22.Mir Aneesuddin: when they entered before Dawood, and he was horrified of them? They said, “Do not fear, we are two disputants, one of us has wronged the other, so decide between us with justice and do not act unjustly and guide us to the balanced path.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: This brother of mine, certainly has ninety and nine ewes and I have (only) one ewe, so he says: Entrust it to me; and shows his might on me in the affair.”

24.Mir Aneesuddin: He (Dawood) said, “He has been unjust to you by demanding your ewe (to be added) to his ewes and many of the partners certainly wrong one another, except those who believe and do righteous works, and their (number) is small.” And Dawood guessed that We had tested him, so he sought the protective forgiveness of his Fosterer and fell down bowing and turned (to Allah).

25.Mir Aneesuddin: So We protectively forgave him that, and certainly, with Us is nearness for him and a beautiful place of return.

26.Mir Aneesuddin: O Dawood! We have made you a successor (to rule) in the earth so judge between mankind with justice and do not follow (your) desire lest it lead you astray from the way of Allah. Those who go astray from the way of Allah, for them there is certainly a severe punishment because they forgot the day of account.

27.Mir Aneesuddin: And We did not create the sky and the earth and whatever is between them in vain, that is the opinion of those who do not believe, so sorrowful will be the state of those who do not believe, due to the fire.

28.Mir Aneesuddin: Shall We make those who believe and do righteous works like those who cause corruption in the earth? Shall We make those who keep themselves in limits like those who exceed the limits?

29.Mir Aneesuddin: A blessed book which We have sent down to you that they may reflect over its signs and that those who understand may be mindful.

30.Mir Aneesuddin: And We granted to Dawood, Sulaiman an excellent servant, he was certainly of those who turned (to Allah).

31.Mir Aneesuddin: When (horses of high breed, which were) still when standing and swift while running, were presented to him in the evening, the evening,

32.Mir Aneesuddin: he said, “ I certainly preferred the love of good things to the remembrance of my Fosterer, to the extent that the (sun) was hidden behind the veil,

33.Mir Aneesuddin: bring them back to me, “ then he began to pass his hand over (their) legs and necks.

34.Mir Aneesuddin: And We indeed tried Sulaiman and We put on his throne a body, then he turned (to Allah).

35.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “ My Fosterer! protectively forgive me and grant me (such) a kingdom (the like of) which will not be possible for anyone (to have) after me. You are certainly the One Who grants.”

36.Mir Aneesuddin: So We subjected to his (service) the wind, to move softly by his command, to which ever place he desired,

37.Mir Aneesuddin: and the devils, every builder and diver,

38.Mir Aneesuddin: and others linked together in chains.

39.Mir Aneesuddin: This is Our gift, so show favor or withhold, without account.

40.Mir Aneesuddin: And certainly, with Us is nearness for him and a beautiful place of return.

41.Mir Aneesuddin: And mention (about) Our servant Iyub, when he prayed to his Fosterer, “The devil has afflicted me with toil and torment.”

42.Mir Aneesuddin: (It was said to him), “Strike with your foot, this (water which thereby gushes out, is for a) cool bath and a drink.”

43.Mir Aneesuddin: And We granted to him his people and the like of them along with them, a mercy from Us and a reminder for men of understanding.

44.Mir Aneesuddin: (It was further said), “Take in your hand a bundle of twigs (of herbs) then strike with it and do not disobey. We certainly found him patient, an excellent servant, he was certainly one who turned (to Allah).

45.Mir Aneesuddin: And mention (about) Our servants Ibrahim and Ishaq and Yaqub men of strength and insight.

46.Mir Aneesuddin: We had purified them for the exclusive reminding of the home (of the hereafter).

47.Mir Aneesuddin: And they are with Us, among those chosen from the doers of good.

48.Mir Aneesuddin: And mention (about) Ismael and Elisha and Zul Kifl and all were from among the doers of good.

49.Mir Aneesuddin: This is a reminder, and for those who guard (against evil), there is a beautiful place of return,

50.Mir Aneesuddin: gardens of everlasting bliss, the doors of which will be kept open for them,

51.Mir Aneesuddin: reclining therein, they will therein call for many fruits and drinks,

52.Mir Aneesuddin: and with them will be females of equal age who restrain their gaze.

53.Mir Aneesuddin: This is what you are promised for the day of account.

54.Mir Aneesuddin: This is Our provision for which there is certainly no end.

55.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be like) this. But for the rebels, there is certainly an evil place of return,

56.Mir Aneesuddin: hell, they will enter it, and (it will be) an evil habitation.

57.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be like) this. So let them taste the boiling water and pus,

58.Mir Aneesuddin: and other (punishments) similar to it in kind.

59.Mir Aneesuddin: This is an army rushing blindly with you, there is no welcome for them, they will certainly enter the fire.

60.Mir Aneesuddin: They will say (to those already in hell), “No, no welcome for you (too), you prepared this in advance for us, so evil is the place /time of stay.”

61.Mir Aneesuddin: They (will continue to) say, “Our Fosterer! he who prepared this in advance for us, increase for him the punishment in the fire (by) doubling (it).”

62.Mir Aneesuddin: And they will say, “What is wrong with us that we do not see the men whom we counted among the evil ones,

63.Mir Aneesuddin: did we take them in ridicule (by mistake) or have our eyes turned away from them (that we do not see them in hell)?”

64.Mir Aneesuddin: That mutual dispute of the dwellers of the fire will certainly be true.

65.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “I am only a warner and there is no god except Allah, the One, the Omnipotent,

66.Mir Aneesuddin: Fosterer of the skies and the earth and whatever is between them, the Mighty, the Protectively Forgiving.”

67.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “It is a great news

68.Mir Aneesuddin: from which you are turning away.

69.Mir Aneesuddin: I do not have any knowledge of the high assembly when they dispute,

70.Mir Aneesuddin: nothing is communicated to me except that I am a clear warner.”

71.Mir Aneesuddin: When your Fosterer said to the angels, “I am creating man from clay,

72.Mir Aneesuddin: so when I set him up in equilibrium and I blow into him from My spirit, then fall bowing down before him.”

73.Mir Aneesuddin: So the angels bowed down, all of them together

74.Mir Aneesuddin: except Iblis, he considered himself great and became (one) of the infidels.

75.Mir Aneesuddin: He (Allah) said, “O Iblis! what prevented you from bowing down before him whom I created with my hands? Did you consider yourself great or are you of those who are high (exalted)?”

76.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “I am better than him, You created me from fire (i.e. energy), whereas You created him from clay (i.e. matter).”

77.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “Get out from here, for you are certainly accursed,

78.Mir Aneesuddin: and My curse is certainly on you till the day of judgment.”

79.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “My Fosterer! give me time till the day they are raised.”

80.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “You are of those who are given time,

81.Mir Aneesuddin: till the day, the timing of which is known.”

82.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “Then by Your might, I will definitely lead them astray, all together,”

83.Mir Aneesuddin: except (those) among them (who are) exclusively Your servants.”

84.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “Then (let this be) the truth, and I speak the truth,

85.Mir Aneesuddin: that I will definitely fill hell with you and those who follow you from among them , all together.”

86.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “I do not ask you for any reward for it and I am not of those who pretend.

87.Mir Aneesuddin: This is nothing but a reminder for the worlds,

88.Mir Aneesuddin: and you will definitely come to know (the truth of) the news (given) in it, after a time.”

1.Mir Aneesuddin: The sending down of the books is from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: We have sent down to you the book containing the truth, so serve Allah making religion exclusively for Him.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: Beware! religion is exclusively for Allah. And those who have taken guardians besides Him (say); “We do not serve (worship) them, except (with the aim) that they may bring us nearer to Allah,” Allah will certainly judge between them in that which they differ. Allah certainly does not guide him who is a liar, ungrateful.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: Had Allah intended to take a son, He could have chosen whom He willed from among those whom He created, Glory be to Him, He is Allah, the One, the Omnipotent.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: He created the skies and the earth in reality. He winds the night over the day and He winds the day over the night (which indicates that the earth rotates). And He has compelled the sun and the moon (to follow His laws), each one moves on for an appointed term. Beware! He is the Mighty, the Protectively Forgiving. the Protectively Forgiving.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: He created you from a single soul then He made from it, its mate, and He send down for you eight pairs of cattle. He creates you in the womb of your mothers, creation after creation in triple darkness. This is Allah your Fosterer, His is the kingdom, there is no god except Him. How then are you turned away?

7.Mir Aneesuddin: If you are ungrateful, then Allah is certainly Independent of you, and He does not like ingratitude for His servants and if you are grateful, He likes it for you. And no bearer of burden will bear the burden of another, then towards your Fosterer is your return and He will inform you about that which you used to do, He is certainly the Knower of what the bosoms possess.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: And when harm afflicts man, he prays to his Fosterer turning towards Him, then when He grants to him favor from Him, he forgets (even) that for which he had prayed to Him earlier, and sets up equals for Allah that he may mislead (people) from His way. Say, “Enjoy a little in your ingratitude, you will certainly be among the inhabitants of the fire.”

9.Mir Aneesuddin: Is he who devoutly prostrates and stands (for worship) during the hours of night, being cautious of the hereafter, and hopes for the mercy of his Fosterer (equal to one who does not do this)? Say, “Are those who know and those who do not know equal?” Only men of understanding are mindful.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “O servants (of Allah) who believe! fear your Fosterer. For those who do good in this world is good and the earth of Allah is vast. Only those who are patient will be paid back their reward without measure.”

11.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “I am commanded that I should serve Allah, making religion exclusively for Him,

12.Mir Aneesuddin: and I am commanded that I should be the first of those who submit (as Muslims).”

13.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “I fear the punishment of the great day, if I disobey my Fosterer.”

14.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “I serve Allah, making my religion exclusively for Him,

15.Mir Aneesuddin: so you serve (worship) that which you will (to serve) besides Him. “Say, ‘The losers are certainly those who cause loss to themselves and their people on the day of resurrection. Beware! that is a clear loss.”

16.Mir Aneesuddin: For them there will be coverings of fire from above them and coverings from below them. Allah makes His servants fear through that. O My servants! then fear Me.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who keep away from serving (worshipping) false deities and turn towards Allah, for them is good news, so convey the good news to My servants,

18.Mir Aneesuddin: who hear a statement then follow the best of it, those are the persons whom Allah has guided and those are the persons who understand.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: Then if there is a person on whom the stated punishment is due, then can you save him who is in the fire?

20.Mir Aneesuddin: But those who fear their Fosterer, for them are built high palaces above which are (still) higher palaces (multistoried buildings), beneath which rivers flow, a promise of Allah, Allah does not go against His promise.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: Did you not see, that Allah sends down water from the sky then makes it move as springs in the earth, then brings out through it vegetation of different colors, then it dries up, then you see it become yellow, then He makes it pieces? There is certainly a reminder in that for men of understanding.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: Then is he, whose bosom Allah has opened for Islam so that he is (guided) by the light from his Fosterer, (like him who is in darkness)? So sorrowful is the state of those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah, they are in a clear error.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah has sent down the best statements (in the form of) a book, (these statements are) similar (to each other and not contradictory and are) repeated. The skins of those who fear their Fosterer tremble (in response to the effect produced) by it, then their skins and their hearts soften towards the remembrance of Allah. That is guidance of Allah, He guides through it whom He wills, and whom Allah leaves to stray then there is no guide for him.

24.Mir Aneesuddin: Then is he, who will have to guard the evil punishment of the day of resurrection from his face, (like him who is safe from it)? And it will be said to those who were unjust, “Taste that which you earned.”

25.Mir Aneesuddin: Those before them (had also) denied, so they did not perceive from where the punishment came to them.

26.Mir Aneesuddin: Thus Allah made them taste disgrace in the life of this world and the punishment of the hereafter is greater, if only they knew.

27.Mir Aneesuddin: And We have set forth for mankind, every (kind) of similitude in this Quran that they may be mindful.

28.Mir Aneesuddin: An Arabic Quran without any crookedness, that they may guard (against evil).

29.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah sets forth the example of a man who is under (the control of many) partners differing with each other, and (another) man wholly (under the control) of one man, are the two equal in likeness? Praise is due only for Allah, no, the majority of them does not know.

30.Mir Aneesuddin: You will certainly die and they (too) will certainly die,

31.Mir Aneesuddin: then on the day of resurrection, you will certainly dispute one with another in the presence of your Fosterer.

32.Mir Aneesuddin: Then who is more unjust than he who speaks a lie against Allah and denies the truth when it comes to him? Will not the home for the infidels be in hell? in hell?

33.Mir Aneesuddin: And he who comes with truth and he who testifies it, those are the persons who guard (against evil),

34.Mir Aneesuddin: for them, with their Fosterer, is what they will (for), that is the reward of the doers of good,

35.Mir Aneesuddin: because Allah will remove from them (the ill effect of even) the worst of that which they did, and reward them with their reward (which will be) better than that which they used to do.

36.Mir Aneesuddin: Is not Allah sufficient for His servant? And they frighten you with those besides Him, and whom Allah leaves to stray, then there is no guide for him.

37.Mir Aneesuddin: And whom Allah guides, then there is none who can mislead him. Is not Allah Mighty, Inflicter of retribution?

38.Mir Aneesuddin: And if you ask them, “Who created the skies and the earth?” Then will definitely say, “Allah.” Say, “They have you considered that which you pray to, besides Allah, if Allah intends to harm me, could they remove from me His harm, or if He intends to be merciful to me, could they withhold from me His mercy?” Say, “Allah is sufficient for me, those who put their trust, do put their trust in Him.”

39.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “O my people! work according to your ability, I (too) am working, so you will come to know,

40.Mir Aneesuddin: on whom will the punishment come, which will disgrace him, and on whom will fall the eternal punishment.”

41.Mir Aneesuddin: We have sent down to you the book containing the truth, for mankind, so one who receives guidance, then (the benefit of) it is for his ownself, and one who goes astray, then (the loss of) his going astray is only on him, and you are not a trustee over them.

42.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah takes the souls  (i.e. consciousness of human beings) at the time of their death, and (He takes the soul) of the person who does not die, during his sleep, then He withholds that on which He has decreed death and sends (back) the others till an appointed term. Certainly there are signs in that for a people who reflect. which He has decreed death and sends (back) the others till an appointed term. Certainly there are signs in that for a people who reflect.

43.Mir Aneesuddin: Have they taken (for worship, things) besides Allah, (for) the purpose of mediation? Say, “Even if they have no control on anything and have no sense?”

44.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “(The power to grant permission for) mediation is totally Allah’s. His is the kingdom of the skies and the earth, then towards Him you will be returned.”

45.Mir Aneesuddin: And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the hereafter, get bored and when those besides Him are mentioned, at that moment they become joyful.

46.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “O Allah! Initiator of the creation of the skies and earth, Knower of the unseen and the seen, You will judge between Your servants regarding that in which they differ.”

47.Mir Aneesuddin: And if those who are unjust, had all that is in the earth and the like of it with it, they would give it as ransom (to free themselves) through it from the evil punishment of the day of resurrection. And (something) from Allah, which they had not (even) thought of, will become manifest to them.

48.Mir Aneesuddin: And the evil which they had earned will become manifest to them, and that which they used to mock at, will surround them.

49.Mir Aneesuddin: So when harm afflicts man he prays to Us, then when We grant to him a favor from Us, he says, “This has been given to me only on the (account of my) knowledge.” No, it is a trail, but majority of them does not know.

50.Mir Aneesuddin: Those before them had (also) said it, but that which they used to earn did not make them carefree from (the consequences of their evil deeds),

51.Mir Aneesuddin: so that the evil of that which they earned afflicted them. And those who are unjust from among these, the evil of that which they earn will afflict them (too), and they will not be able to defeat (Allah). defeat (Allah).

52.Mir Aneesuddin: Do they not know that Allah enlarges the provision for whomever He wills and straitens (it for whomever and whenever He wills). Certainly there are signs in that for a people who believe.

53.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “O My servants who have committed excesses against their own souls! do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Allah certainly protectively forgives all the sins, He is certainly Protectively Forgiving, Merciful.”

54.Mir Aneesuddin: And turn towards your Fosterer and submit to Him before the punishment comes to you, then you will not be helped.

55.Mir Aneesuddin: And follow the best which is sent down to you from your Fosterer before the punishment comes to you suddenly while you do not perceive,

56.Mir Aneesuddin: lest a soul should say, “My regrets on being negligent towards Allah’s side, and I was of those who mocked,”

57.Mir Aneesuddin: or say, “If Allah has guided me I (too) would have been among those who guarded (against evil),”

58.Mir Aneesuddin: or say at the time it sees the punishment, “Had there been a second chance for me (to go back to the world, then) I would be of those who do good.”

59.Mir Aneesuddin: No, My signs had come to you but you denied them and you considered yourself great and you were among the infidels.

60.Mir Aneesuddin: And on the day of resurrection, you will see the faces of those who lied against Allah, (coloured) black. Is not the home of the proud in hell ?

61.Mir Aneesuddin: And Allah will save those who guarded (against evil) because of their achievement, evil will not touch them nor will they grieve.

62.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah is the Creator of everything and He is a Trustee over everything.

63.Mir Aneesuddin: His are the keys of the skies and earth. And those who do not believe in the signs of Allah, those are the persons who are the losers.

64.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Then do you advise me to worship (something) other than Allah, O you ignorant people?”

65.Mir Aneesuddin: And it has been communicated to you and those before you: If you associate partners (with Allah), your work will definitely become fruitless and you will definitely be among the losers.

66.Mir Aneesuddin: No, then serve Allah and be among those who are grateful.

67.Mir Aneesuddin: And they have not estimated Allah with the estimation due to Him. And the earth will be totally in His grip on the day of resurrection, with the skies rolled up in His right hand. Glorified is He and high (above) that which they associate as partners (with Him).

68.Mir Aneesuddin: And it will be blown into the trumpet (structure of the universe), so whoever is in the skies and whoever is in the earth will fall down senseless except he whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown into it a second time when they will stand seeing.

69.Mir Aneesuddin: And the earth will shine with the light of its Fosterer. And the record (of deeds) will be laid down and the prophets (informers) and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them with justice and they will not be dealt with unjustly.

70.Mir Aneesuddin: And every soul will be paid back in full for that which it did, and He knows best about that which they do.

71.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who did not believe will be driven to hell in troops until when they come to it, the doors of it will be opened and its guards will say to them, “Did messengers from among yourselves not come to you, reciting to you the signs of your Fosterer and warning you about the meeting of this day of yours?” They will say, “Why not, but the statement of punishment has become binding on the infidels.” unishment has become binding on the infidels.”

72.Mir Aneesuddin: It will be said, “Enter the doors of hell to stay therein.” So evil is the home of the proud.

73.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who feared their Fosterer will be driven to the garden in troops until when they come to it, the doors of it will be opened and the guards of it will say to them, “Peace be on you, you are happy (lucky), so enter it to stay.”

74.Mir Aneesuddin: And they will say, “Praise is due only for Allah Who has been true to us in His promise and He has made us to inherit the earth, we can settle down in the garden wherever we will.” So excellent is the reward of the workers.

75.Mir Aneesuddin: And you will see the angels inclining from (all) round (towards) the throne* glorifying by praising their Fosterer. And it will be judged between them with justice and it will be said, “Praise is due only for Allah, the Fosterer of the worlds.”  * Probably the capital of the Universe.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Haa Miim.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: The sending down of the book is from Allah, the Mighty, the Knowing.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: Protective Forgiver of sin and Accepter of repentance, Severe in requital, the Bountiful. There is no god except Him, towards Him is the destination.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: None dispute concerning the signs of Allah except those who do not believe, so do not let their going to and fro in the cities deceive you.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: The people of Nuh and the parties after them had denied earlier to these (people). And all communities had planned against their messenger to catch him and had disputed through falsehood so that they might make the truth to slip off through it, so I (too) caught them. Then how was My retribution?

6.Mir Aneesuddin: And thus the statement of your Fosterer became binding on those who did not believe that they will be the inhabitants of the fire.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who bear ( the burden of ) the throne ( of the universe ) and those around it, glorify by praising their Fosterer and they believe in Him and seek protective forgiveness for those who believe: “Our Fosterer ! You embrace everything in mercy and knowledge, so protectively forgive those who repent and follow Your way and save them from the punishment of hell.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: Our Fosterer ! and make them enter the gardens of everlasting bliss which You have promised them, and whoever is righteous from among their fathers and their mates and their descendants, You are certainly the Mighty, the Wise.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: And save them from evil deeds, and whom You save from ( the consequences of ) evil deeds on that day, You have indeed shown mercy to him, and that is the great achievement.”

10.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who did not believe will certainly be called out, “Allah’s hatred is greater than your hatred of yourselves ( now, because ) when you were invited towards belief you rejected.”
