21.Mir Aneesuddin: and other (gains) on which you do not have power (right now), Allah has indeed encompassed them (for you) and Allah has power over everything,

22.Mir Aneesuddin: And if those who do not believe fight with you, they would certainly turn (their) backs, then they would not find any guardian or a helper.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: (This has been the) procedure of Allah which has passed earlier and you will never find a change in the procedure of Allah.

24.Mir Aneesuddin: And it was He Who had held back their hands from you and your hands from them in the interior of Mecca, after He had given you victory over them , and Allah is the Seer of what you do.

25.Mir Aneesuddin: Those were the persons who did not believe and turned you away from the Sacred Mosque and stopped the offering from reaching its destination. And had believing men and believing women not been there, whom you did not know and whom you would have trampled, then distress would have befallen you on account of them, unknowingly. (You were held back) so that Allah may make to enter into His mercy, whom He wills. Had they (the believers and infidels) been separated (one from another). We would have punished those who did not believe from among them, with a painful punishment.

26.Mir Aneesuddin: When those who did not believe, cherished in their hearts a rage and (that too) the rage of ignorance, then Allah sent down His tranquility on His messenger and on the believers, and made them stick to the statement of restrain, and they deserved it and were worthy of it, and Allah has knowledge of everything.

27.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah indeed made true, His messenger’s vision of reality, that if Allah wills, you will definitely enter the Sacred Mosque secure, (some) having your heads shaved while (others having their hair) reduced, (entering) without fear. So He knew that which you did not know, therefore He brought about a near victory (of Khaiber), besides that.

28.Mir Aneesuddin: He it is Who has sent His messenger with guidance and the religion of truth that He may make it prevail over every religion, and Allah is sufficient as a Witness.

29.Mir Aneesuddin: Muhammed is the messenger of Allah, and those with him are strong against the infidels and merciful among themselves. You see them bowing down, prostrating, seeking grace from Allah and (His) pleasure, their marks due to the effect of, prostrations are there in their faces. That is their likeness (mentioned) in the Torah and their likeness mentioned in the Injeel. (They are) like vegetation which (first) puts forth its sprout then it becomes firm then it becomes thick, then it stands balanced on its stem, pleasing the sowers, that He may make the infidels angry through them. Allah has promised those among them who believe and do righteous works, protective forgiveness and a great reward.

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe ! do not precede Allah and His messenger and fear Allah, Allah is certainly Hearing, Knowing.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet and do not speak aloud to him while talking (to him) as you speak aloud to each other, lest your deeds become fruitless while you do not perceive.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who lower their voices in the presence of the messenger of Allah, are certainly those whose hearts Allah has cleared for (receiving the quality of) guarding (against evil), for them there is protective forgiveness and a great reward.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who call you from behind the private apartments, most of them have no sense.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: And had they remained patient till you had come out to them, it would have been better for them, and Allah is Protectively Forgiving, Merciful.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe ! if a transgressor comes to you with (some) news, then verify it, lest you harm a people in ignorance then become sorry for what you did.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: And know that among you is the messenger of Allah, if he were to obey you in many an affair, you would be in difficulty, but Allah has made the belief (an item of) love for you and He has beautified it in your hearts, and He has made infidelity and transgression and disobedience (items of) dislike to you, those are the persons on the right way,

8.Mir Aneesuddin: a grace from Allah and (His) favour and Allah is Knowing, Wise.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: And if two groups from among the believers fight, effect reconciliation between them, but if one of them wrongfully oppresses the other then fight against the one which has wrongfully oppressed, till it returns to Allah’s command, then if it returns effect reconciliation between them with justice and act equitably, Allah certainly likes those who are equitable.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: The believers are but brothers, so effect reconciliation between your brothers and fear Allah that you may be dealt with mercifully.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe ! do not let (some) people consider (other) people lower than (themselves), it may be that (the other people) are better than them, nor let (some) women, (consider other )women (lower than themselves), it may be that (the other women) are better than them. And do not find fault (among) yourselves, nor call (one another) by nicknames, (even taking) the name of transgression is an evil after (having) believed, and those who do not repent, then those are the persons who are unjust.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! avoid much of suspicion, (because) suspicion in some (cases) is certainly a sin, and do not spy (being inquisitive about the secrets of others) and do not backbite one another, would anyone of you love to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You dislike it! And fear Allah, Allah is certainly the Accepter of repentance, Merciful.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: O mankind ! We created you from a male and a female and made you nations and tribes that you may recognize each other (as to who belongs to which nationality or tribe. But) the most honoured of you with Allah is certainly the one who guards most (against evil), Allah is certainly Knowing, Informed.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: The desert Arabs say, “We have believed.” Say, “You have not (yet) believed (in the real sense of the word), therefore say, we have submitted, and belief has not yet entered into your hearts, and if you obey Allah and His messenger, He will not reduce anything from (the reward of) your deeds, Allah is certainly Protectively Forgiving, Merciful.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: The (true) believers are only those who believe in Allah and His messenger then they do not doubt, and they strive with their wealth and their persons in the way of Allah, those are the persons who are truthful.”

16.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Would you make Allah know your religion when Allah knows whatever is in the skies and whatever is in the earth and (when) Allah is the Knower of everything?”

17.Mir Aneesuddin: They consider it their favour on you that they have accepted Islam. Say, “Do not consider your accepting Islam as a favour on me, no, Allah confers a favour on you by guiding you towards belief, if you are truthful.

18.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah certainly knows the unseen of the skies and the earth and Allah is a Seer of what you do.”

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Qaaf. By the glorious Quran.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: No, they wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves, so the infidels say, “This is a wonderful thing.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: What! when we are dead and become (part of the)soil, (will we then be raised to life again)? That is a return far (from probable).”

4.Mir Aneesuddin: We indeed know that which the earth reduces from them and with Us is a protected record.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: No, they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are left confused in the affair.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: Did they not then look at the sky above them, how We have constructed it and adorned it and (that) there are no openings in it,

7.Mir Aneesuddin: and the earth, (how) We have stretched it and (how) We have put mountains in it and (how) We have caused to grow every kind of beautiful thing in it?

8.Mir Aneesuddin: (These are sources of) insight and a reminder for every servant who turns (to Allah).

9.Mir Aneesuddin: And We send down blessed water from the sky, then We cause to grow through it gardens and grain that is reaped,

10.Mir Aneesuddin: and tall date palms, the produce of which is layered,

11.Mir Aneesuddin: a provision for (Our) servants, and We give life through it to a dead land, thus will be the coming out (on the day of resurrection).

12.Mir Aneesuddin: (Those who) denied before them (were): people of Nuh and the inhabitants of Ar Raas and Samood

13.Mir Aneesuddin: and Aad and Firawn and the brothers of Lut

14.Mir Aneesuddin: and the inhabitants of the jungle and the people of Tubba, all denied the messengers so My threat became incumbent.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: Were We then tired due to the first creation? No, they are in confusion about the new creation.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: And We have created man and We know what his soul (mind) whispers to him, and We are nearer to him than his life vein,

17.Mir Aneesuddin: when the two receivers (while) sitting, receive from the right and from the left,

18.Mir Aneesuddin: he does not utter a word but one vigilant near him is ready.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: And the intoxication of death will really come, (when it will be said), “That is what you used to run away from.”

20.Mir Aneesuddin: And it will be blown into the trumpet (structure of the universe), that will be the threatened day.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: And every soul will come, with it will be a driver and a witness.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be said), “You were heedless of this, but We have removed from you your covering, so this day your sight is sharp.”

23.Mir Aneesuddin: And his comrade will say, “This (record) which is with me is ready.”

24.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be ordered), “Both of you (driver and witness or the two angels on the right and the left of each person), put into hell, every ungrateful transgressor,

25.Mir Aneesuddin: forbidder of good, exceeder of limits, doubter,

26.Mir Aneesuddin: he who sets up another god with Allah, so both of you put him into the severe punishment.”

27.Mir Aneesuddin: His comrade will say, “Our Fosterer! I did not cause him to rebel but he was (himself) far away in error.”

28.Mir Aneesuddin: He will say, “Do not dispute in My presence, and I had indeed (informed you about) the threatening in advance,

29.Mir Aneesuddin: (therefore) the statement from Me will not be changed and I am not unjust to My servants.”

30.Mir Aneesuddin: The day We will say to hell, “Are you filled?” And it will say, “Are there any more?”

31.Mir Aneesuddin: And the garden will be brought near to those who had guarded (against evil), not being far away.

32.Mir Aneesuddin: This is what you were promised, (it is) for every one who turns (to Allah, being a) protector (of His religion),

33.Mir Aneesuddin: who fears the Beneficent (Allah) without having seen (Him), and comes with a heart turning in repentance.

34.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be said to him): “Enter it in peace, that is the eternal day.”* * Period

35.Mir Aneesuddin: For them therein, there will be what they will for, and more from Us.

36.Mir Aneesuddin: And how many a generation did We destroy before them, who were stronger than them in taking hold (of others), but We made them to wander (from place to place) in the lands (asking), “Is there (a place of) refuge?”

37.Mir Aneesuddin: There is certainly a reminder in that for him who has a heart or gives ear (i.e. hears) and he is one who witnesses.

38.Mir Aneesuddin: And We created the skies and the earth and that which is between them in six periods, and weariness did not (even) touch Us.

39.Mir Aneesuddin: So be patient over what they say, and glorify by praising your Fosterer before the rising of the sun and before its setting,

40.Mir Aneesuddin: and (during parts) of the night glorify Him and after the prostrations (of salat).

41.Mir Aneesuddin: And listen ! on the day when the announcer will announce from a near place,

42.Mir Aneesuddin: the day when they will hear the loud cry in reality, that will be the day of coming out (from the earth).

43.Mir Aneesuddin: (It is) certainly We (Who) give life and cause to die and towards Us is the destination.

44.Mir Aneesuddin: The day the earth will split from (above) them, (they will come out) fast, that is an easy gathering together for Us.

45.Mir Aneesuddin: We know best about that which they say, and you are not a compiler over them, therefore remind through the Quran, him who fears My threat.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: By the scatterers, scattering,

2.Mir Aneesuddin: then those bearing heaviness,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: then those moving easily,

4.Mir Aneesuddin: then those distributing the affair (or command) ,

5.Mir Aneesuddin: that which you are promised is certainly true,

6.Mir Aneesuddin: and the judgment will certainly take place.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: By the sky possessing ways,

8.Mir Aneesuddin: you are certainly differing in word (opinions).

9.Mir Aneesuddin: He is turned away from the (truth), who (himself) turns away.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: Slain be the liars,

11.Mir Aneesuddin: those who are heedless in ignorance.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: They ask, “When is the day of judgment?”

13.Mir Aneesuddin: The day on which they will be punished over the fire,

14.Mir Aneesuddin: (it will be said), "Taste your punishment, this is what you sought to be hastened."

15.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who had guarded (against evil) will certainly be in gardens and springs,

16.Mir Aneesuddin: taking that which their Fosterer gives them. Before that they certainly used to be doers of good.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: It was (only) a small (part) of the night (during) which they used to sleep,

18.Mir Aneesuddin: and they used to ask for protective forgiveness at dawns,

19.Mir Aneesuddin: and in their wealth there was a right (i.e. a portion) for him who begged and for him who was prevented (from begging).

20.Mir Aneesuddin: And in the earth there are signs for those who are certain,

21.Mir Aneesuddin: and in yourselves (too). Will you not then see?

22.Mir Aneesuddin: And in the sky is your provision and that which you are promised.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: So by the Fosterer of the sky and the earth, it is certainly a truth similar (to the truth) that you speak.

24.Mir Aneesuddin: Has the story of the honoured guests of Ibrahim come to you?

25.Mir Aneesuddin: When they entered upon him then said, “Peace.” He said, “Peace, people not recognisable.”

26.Mir Aneesuddin: Then he went towards his people and brought a (roasted) fat calf,

27.Mir Aneesuddin: and set it near them (and) said, “Will you not eat?”

28.Mir Aneesuddin: So he conceived a fear due to them. They said, “Do not fear,” and they gave him the good news of (the birth of) a boy possessing knowledge.

29.Mir Aneesuddin: At (this news) his wife came forward in (a state of wonder), shouting and striking her face, and said, “(How can I have a child when I am) a barren old woman?”

30.Mir Aneesuddin: They said, “Thus (it will be), says your Fosterer. He is certainly the Wise, the Knowing.”

31.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “Then what is your affair (for which you have been sent) O you messengers?”

32.Mir Aneesuddin: They said, “We are sent to a criminal people

33.Mir Aneesuddin: that we may send upon them (porous) stones of clay,

34.Mir Aneesuddin: marked from your Fosterer for (the punishment of) the extravagant.”

35.Mir Aneesuddin: Then We brought out those who believed from among them,

36.Mir Aneesuddin: but We did not find therein any Muslims except (in) one house.

37.Mir Aneesuddin: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

38.Mir Aneesuddin: And in Musa (there is a sign) when We sent him to Firawn with clear authority.

39.Mir Aneesuddin: But he turned away with his force and said, “A magician or one influenced by the jinn.”

40.Mir Aneesuddin: So We caught him and his army and threw them into (the flowing water of) the sea and he was blameworthy.

41.Mir Aneesuddin: And in Aad (there is a sign) when We sent on them the barren wind (for their destruction).

42.Mir Aneesuddin: It did not leave anything with which it came (in contact) without making it as if decomposed.

43.Mir Aneesuddin: And in Samood (there is a sign) when it was said to them, “Enjoy till a (set) time.”

44.Mir Aneesuddin: But they revolted against the command of their Fosterer, so the thunderbolt took hold of them while they were seeing.

45.Mir Aneesuddin: So they were not able to stand nor were they able to defend themselves.

46.Mir Aneesuddin: And the people of Nuh earlier (to them), they (too) were a transgressing people.

47.Mir Aneesuddin: And the sky, We constructed it with energy, and We are the Expanders (of it)*. * See notes under Ch. 21, Vs. 30 & 104

48.Mir Aneesuddin: And the earth, We have spread it. How Excellent are We in making it habitable!

49.Mir Aneesuddin: And of everything We have created pairs that you may be mindful.

50.Mir Aneesuddin: So you all run towards Allah, I am a clear warner for you from Him.

51.Mir Aneesuddin: And do not set up another god with Allah, I am a clear warner for you from Him.

52.Mir Aneesuddin: Thus, there did not come to those before them any messenger but they said, “A magician or one influenced by jinn.”

53.Mir Aneesuddin: Do they recommend this to one another? No, they are a rebellious people.

54.Mir Aneesuddin: So turn away from them, because you are not blameworthy.

55.Mir Aneesuddin: And be reminding, because reminding certainly benefits the believers.

56.Mir Aneesuddin: And I did not create the jinn and mankind but (with the sole purpose) that they should serve Me.

57.Mir Aneesuddin: 1 do not intend (to get) any provision from them nor do I intend that they should feed Me.

58.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah is certainly the Provider, Possessor of power, the Strong.

59.Mir Aneesuddin: So for those who are unjust, (their) portion will certainly be like the portion of their companions, so do not let them ask Me to hasten on (the punishment).

60.Mir Aneesuddin: So sorrowful is the state of those who do not believe because of their day which they are threatened with.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: By the mountain

2.Mir Aneesuddin: and the written book

3.Mir Aneesuddin: in open pages

4.Mir Aneesuddin: and the house that is visited

5.Mir Aneesuddin: and the elevated roof

6.Mir Aneesuddin: and the overflowing sea.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: The punishment of your Fosterer will certainly be brought into effect,

8.Mir Aneesuddin: there will be no one to repel it.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: The day the sky will whirl (with a) whirl

10.Mir Aneesuddin: and the mountains will pass away, passing away.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: Sorrowful will be the state on that day of those who deny,

12.Mir Aneesuddin: who playfully (get involved) in idle talk,

13.Mir Aneesuddin: the day they will be pushed towards the fire (with) a pushing.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be said), “This is the fire which you used to deny.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: Then is it magic, or do you not see?

16.Mir Aneesuddin: Enter it, then be patient or impatient, it is equal for you, you will be rewarded only for that which you used to do.”

17.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who had guarded (against evil) will certainly be in gardens and in happiness,

18.Mir Aneesuddin: rejoicing because of that which their Fosterer has given them and (because) their Fosterer protected them from the punishment of hell.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be said to them), “Eat and drink pleasantly because of that which you used to do.”

20.Mir Aneesuddin: (They will), recline on couches arranged in ranks and We will pair them with fair ones with wide beautiful eyes.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who believe and their descendants who follow (them) in belief, We will unite with them their descendants, and We will not reduce anything from (the reward of) their deeds. Every man is in pledge (security) for that which he has earned.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: And We will support them with fruit and flesh such as they desire.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: Therein they will take from one another, a cup in which there will be nothing vain nor any sin.

24.Mir Aneesuddin: And for them, boys will go around them. (They will be) as if they were hidden pearls.

25.Mir Aneesuddin: While facing one another they will inquire from each other,

26.Mir Aneesuddin: saying, “Earlier, while we were among our people we were certainly afraid,

27.Mir Aneesuddin: but Allah has been gracious to us and has protected us from the punishment of the heat wave.

28.Mir Aneesuddin: We certainly used to pray to Him earlier, He is certainly the Benign (obliging), the Merciful.”

29.Mir Aneesuddin: So be reminding, because by the grace of your Fosterer, you are neither a soothsayer nor one influenced by jinn.

30.Mir Aneesuddin: Or do they say, “(He is) a poet, for whom we are waiting for an accident of time?”

31.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Wait, because I am also with you, of those who wait.”

32.Mir Aneesuddin: Or do their understandings enjoin them to (utter) this (statement) or are they a rebellious people?

33.Mir Aneesuddin: Or do they say, “He has invented it?” No, they do not believe.

34.Mir Aneesuddin: Then let them bring a statement similar to it, (if the Quran can be invented by any human being and) if they are truthful.

35.Mir Aneesuddin: Or were they created from nothing (or by no one)? Or were they (themselves their) creators?

36.Mir Aneesuddin: Or did they create the skies and the earth? No, they have no certainty.

37.Mir Aneesuddin: Or do they have with them the treasures of your Fosterer? Or are they the managers?

38.Mir Aneesuddin: Or do they have a ladder by (climbing on) which they seek to hear? Then let their listener come with a clear authority.

39.Mir Aneesuddin: Or has He daughters and for you there are sons?

40.Mir Aneesuddin: Or do you ask them for a reward so that they are burdened with a debt?

41.Mir Aneesuddin: Or is (the knowledge of) the unseen with them that they write (it) down?

42.Mir Aneesuddin: Or do they intend to plot? Then those who do not believe, they (themselves) are under the influence of a plot.

43.Mir Aneesuddin: Or is there for them a god other than Allah? Glory be to Allah (He is high above) that which they associate as partners (with Him).

44.Mir Aneesuddin: And (even) if they see a piece of the sky fall, they would say, “A heaped cloud.”

45.Mir Aneesuddin: So leave them till they meet that day of theirs wherein they will fall down senseless.

46.Mir Aneesuddin: The day their plot will not make them free from anything, nor will they be helped.

47.Mir Aneesuddin: And for those who are unjust, there will certainly be a punishment besides that, but the majority of them does not know.

48.Mir Aneesuddin: So wait patiently for the command of your Fosterer, for you are certainly before Our eyes. And glorify your Fosterer by praising (Him) at the time you rise

49.Mir Aneesuddin: and in the night glorify Him and after (the disappearance of) the stars.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: By the star when it sets.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: Your companion neither went astray nor was he misled,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: nor does he speak out of (his own) desire.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: It is nothing but a communication, communicated.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: One (Jibraeel) severe in strength, made it known to him

6.Mir Aneesuddin: (he) possesses vigor so he sought equilibrium

7.Mir Aneesuddin: when he was on the high horizon.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: Then he came near and he came down

9.Mir Aneesuddin: and was at a distance of two bows, length or closer,

10.Mir Aneesuddin: then he communicated to His servant that which he communicated.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: The heart did not lie (in communicating) what it saw.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: What ! do you dispute with him as to what he saw?

13.Mir Aneesuddin: And he indeed saw him (Jibraeel) in another descent,

14.Mir Aneesuddin: near the farthest lote tree

15.Mir Aneesuddin: near which is the garden for staying,

16.Mir Aneesuddin: when that covered the lote tree which covered.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: The sight neither deviated nor exceeded the limits.

18.Mir Aneesuddin: He indeed saw (some) of the greater signs of his Fosterer.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: Did you (ever) see Al Lat and Al Uzza

20.Mir Aneesuddin: and Manat the third (and) the last (idol)?

21.Mir Aneesuddin: What! for you the males and for Him the females?

22.Mir Aneesuddin: Then that is an unfair division.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: They are nothing but names which you have named, you and your fathers, for which Allah has not sent down any authority. They follow nothing but conjecture and that which their souls desire, though the guidance has come to them from their Fosterer.

24.Mir Aneesuddin: Or, shall man have what (all) he desires?

25.Mir Aneesuddin: But Allah’s is the hereafter (future) and the former (past).

26.Mir Aneesuddin: And how many an angel is there in the skies, whose recommendation will be of no use in anything, except after Allah gives permission to whom He wills and pleases.

27.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who do not believe in the hereafter certainly name the angels with female names,

28.Mir Aneesuddin: and they do not have any knowledge about it, they follow nothing but conjecture, and conjecture is certainly of no use in anything compared to the truth.

29.Mir Aneesuddin: So keep away from him who turns away from Our remembrance and desires nothing but the life of this world.

30.Mir Aneesuddin: That is the (ultimate) reach of their knowledge. Your Fosterer certainly knows best, him who goes astray from His way, and He knows best, him who receives guidance.

31.Mir Aneesuddin: And whatever is in the skies and whatever is in the earth is Allah’s that He may reward those who do evil for that which they did and (that) He may reward those who do good with (something) better.

32.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who avoid great sins and indecencies except small faults, (then) your Fosterer is certainly Ample in protectively forgiving (them). He knew you best when He produced you from the earth and when you were hidden in the wombs of your mothers, therefore do not attribute purity to yourselves. He knows best him who guards (against evil).

33.Mir Aneesuddin: Did you not see him who turns his back

34.Mir Aneesuddin: and gives a little and withholds?

35.Mir Aneesuddin: Has he with him the knowledge of the unseen so that he sees?

36.Mir Aneesuddin: Or was he not informed of that which was in the books of Musa

37.Mir Aneesuddin: and Ibrahim, who fulfilled (his responsibility by informing):

38.Mir Aneesuddin: that no bearer of burden will bear the burden of another,

39.Mir Aneesuddin: and that there is nothing for man except that which he strives for

40.Mir Aneesuddin: and that his striving will be seen,

41.Mir Aneesuddin: then he will be rewarded for it with a full reward,

42.Mir Aneesuddin: and that towards your Fosterer is the (ultimate) goal,

43.Mir Aneesuddin: and that it is He Who makes (one) laugh and makes (one) weep

44.Mir Aneesuddin: and that it is He Who gives death and gives life,

45.Mir Aneesuddin: and that He created the pairs, the male and the female

46.Mir Aneesuddin: from the sperm when it was poured

47.Mir Aneesuddin: and that on Him is (the responsibility of) the later production (creation after death)

48.Mir Aneesuddin: and that it is He Who gives riches and satisfaction,

49.Mir Aneesuddin: and that He is the Fosterer of the (star) Sirius

50.Mir Aneesuddin: and that He destroyed the ancient Aad,

51.Mir Aneesuddin: and Samood, He did not allow to remain,

52.Mir Aneesuddin: and the people of Nuh earlier, because they were more unjust and more rebellious,

53.Mir Aneesuddin: and the overthrown cities, He overthrew,

54.Mir Aneesuddin: so there covered them that which covered?

55.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you dispute about?

56.Mir Aneesuddin: This is a warner like the ancient warners.

57.Mir Aneesuddin: The approaching one draws near,

58.Mir Aneesuddin: none besides Allah can expose it.

59.Mir Aneesuddin: Do you then wonder at this statement.

60.Mir Aneesuddin: and you laugh and do not weep,

61.Mir Aneesuddin: while you are involved in vanities (being heedless of your duty)?

62.Mir Aneesuddin: Therefore bow down before Allah and serve (Him).

1.Mir Aneesuddin: The hour drew near and the moon was split .

2.Mir Aneesuddin: And if they see a sign they turn away and say, “Magic (of old) repeated.”

3.Mir Aneesuddin: And they denied and followed their desires. And every affair has a (set) time/place of happening.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: And there has come to them (that part) of the news in which there is (a warning for them) to restrain,

5.Mir Aneesuddin: mature wisdom, but warnings are of no use (to them),

6.Mir Aneesuddin: so turn away from them. The day an announcer will call them towards an awful thing put,

7.Mir Aneesuddin: with their sight humbled, they will come out of the graves, as if they were scattered locusts,

8.Mir Aneesuddin: hastening with their eyes fixed towards the announcer. The infidels will say, “This is a day of difficulty.”

9.Mir Aneesuddin: The people of Nuh denied before them, so they denied Our servant and said, “One influenced by jinn,” and he was scolded and driven away.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: Then he prayed to his Fosterer, “I am overcome so help me.”

11.Mir Aneesuddin: So We opened the gates of the sky with water pouring forth,

12.Mir Aneesuddin: and We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met for (the execution of) an affair already programmed.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: And We carried him on (the ship) made of planks and nails (or planks tied with palm fibre),

14.Mir Aneesuddin: sailing before Our eyes, a reward for him who was rejected.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: And We left it as a sign, but is there anyone who will mind?

16.Mir Aneesuddin: Then how (terrible) was My punishment and My warning!

17.Mir Aneesuddin: And We have indeed made the Quran easy to remember (understand and be mindful), but is there anyone who will mind?

18.Mir Aneesuddin: Aad denied, then how (terrible) was My punishment and My warning!

19.Mir Aneesuddin: We sent on them a furious wind during the day (period) of repeated loss,

20.Mir Aneesuddin: uprooting men as if they were trunks of uprooted date palms.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: Then how (terrible) was My punishment and My warning!

22.Mir Aneesuddin: And We have indeed made the Quran easy to remember, but is there anyone who will mind?

23.Mir Aneesuddin: Samood were deniers of the warnings,

24.Mir Aneesuddin: so they said, “Should we follow him who is a single man from among us? We will then certainly be in error and madness.

25.Mir Aneesuddin: Has the reminder been made to come down (only) on him from among (all of) us? No, he is a self interested liar.”

26.Mir Aneesuddin: Tomorrow they will know who is a self interested liar.

27.Mir Aneesuddin: We are sending the she camel as a test for them, so be vigilant (over) them and be patient.

28.Mir Aneesuddin: And inform them that the water is to be shared between (the she camel and) them, each one should be present (for) the drink (at one’s turn).

29.Mir Aneesuddin: But they called their companion, so he took (the sword) then slew (the she camel).

30.Mir Aneesuddin: Then how (terrible) was My punishment and My warning!

31.Mir Aneesuddin: We sent on them a single loud cry so they became like dry broken pieces (of trees used to make) an enclosure (for the cattle or around fields).

32.Mir Aneesuddin: And We indeed made the Quran easy to remember, but is there anyone who will mind?

33.Mir Aneesuddin: The people of Lut were deniers of the warnings.

34.Mir Aneesuddin: We sent on them a sand storm (or volcanic debris), except the followers of Lut, We delivered them by dawn.

35.Mir Aneesuddin: A favour from Us, thus do We reward him who is grateful.

36.Mir Aneesuddin: And he had warned them of Our seizure but they doubted and disputed about the warnings.

37.Mir Aneesuddin: And they even sought to take away from him his guests (for an evil purpose), but We blinded their eyes, so taste My punishment and My warning.

38.Mir Aneesuddin: The punishment set (to befall) at its place/time of happening, befell them in the morning.

39.Mir Aneesuddin: So taste My punishment and My warning.

40.Mir Aneesuddin: And We indeed made the Quran easy to remember, but is there anyone who will mind?

41.Mir Aneesuddin: And the warnings came to the people of Firawn

42.Mir Aneesuddin: but they were deniers of Our signs, each of them, so We seized them (with a) seizure of One Mighty, Powerful.

43.Mir Aneesuddin: Are infidels (among) you better than those or is there a freedom for you in the scriptures?

44.Mir Aneesuddin: Or do they say, “We are a defended army.”

45.Mir Aneesuddin: The army will be defeated and they will be made to turn their backs.

46.Mir Aneesuddin: No, the hour of doom is their promised time and the hour of doom will be most grievous and most bitter.

47.Mir Aneesuddin: The criminals are certainly in error and madness.

48.Mir Aneesuddin: On the day they will be dragged into the fire on their faces, (it will be said), “Taste the affliction of hell.”

49.Mir Aneesuddin: We have certainly created everything with a programme.

50.Mir Aneesuddin: And Our command is but one, like the twinkling of an eye.

51.Mir Aneesuddin: And We indeed destroyed sects (like those of) yours, but is there anyone who will mind?

52.Mir Aneesuddin: And everything they did, is in the books

53.Mir Aneesuddin: and everything small or great is written down (recorded).

54.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who guard (against evil) will certainly be in gardens with rivers,

55.Mir Aneesuddin: in a confirmed seat, near the King, the Holder of power.

55.SurahEnglishNames: The Beneficent, The Mercy Giving, The Merciful

1.Mir Aneesuddin: The Beneficent.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: He taught the Quran,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: He created man,

4.Mir Aneesuddin: He taught him to express (by action, speech, writing etc).

5.Mir Aneesuddin: The sun and the moon (function) according to a calculation.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: And the herbs and the trees bow down (to Him).

7.Mir Aneesuddin: And the sky, He has raised it, and He has set the balance

8.Mir Aneesuddin: (by ordering) that: Do not exceed (the limits) in the balance

9.Mir Aneesuddin: and establish the balance in a just manner and do not reduce the balance.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And the earth He has layed down for the cattle (living beings).

11.Mir Aneesuddin: Therein are fruits and palm trees (with) sheathed (dates)

12.Mir Aneesuddin: and grains with husk and the scented herb.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

14.Mir Aneesuddin: He created man from mud, like (that used in) pottery.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: And He created the jinn from (the heat wave) let free from fire.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

17.Mir Aneesuddin: Fosterer of the two places/times of sun rise and Fosterer of the two places/times of sun set (at the summer and winter solstice).

18.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

19.Mir Aneesuddin: He let free the two seas (which) meet

20.Mir Aneesuddin: (but) between them is a barrier which they do not pass.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

22.Mir Aneesuddin: There come out from both of them pearls and corals.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

24.Mir Aneesuddin: And His are the ships, with elevated sails, (sailing) in the sea, like mountains.

25.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

26.Mir Aneesuddin: All who are on it will perish

27.Mir Aneesuddin: and there will remain the Face (Person) of your Fosterer, Possessor of glory and honour.

28.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

29.Mir Aneesuddin: Whoever is in the skies and the earth asks from Him, everyday (each moment) He is in a state (of intending something or implementing some affair).

30.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

31.Mir Aneesuddin: We will free (Ourselves) for you, O you two weighty (things).

32.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

33.Mir Aneesuddin: O assembly of jinn and mankind! if you are able to pass through the boundaries (or spheres) of the skies and the earth, then pass through, you will not pass through except with authority.

34.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

35.Mir Aneesuddin: Flames of fire (without smoke) and hot smoke (without flames) will be sent on you both, then you will not be able to defend.

36.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

37.Mir Aneesuddin: So when the sky splits and becomes red like red hide.

38.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

39.Mir Aneesuddin: So on that day neither man nor jinn will be questioned about his sin.

40.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

41.Mir Aneesuddin: The criminals will be recognised by their marks, so they will be caught by the forelocks and feet.

42.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

43.Mir Aneesuddin: This is hell which the criminals denied,

44.Mir Aneesuddin: they will go round between it and between hot boiling water.

45.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

46.Mir Aneesuddin: And for him who feared to stand before his Fosterer are two gardens.

47.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

48.Mir Aneesuddin: Having in them various kinds.

49.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

50.Mir Aneesuddin: In both of them are flowing springs.

51.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

52.Mir Aneesuddin: In both of them every (kind) of fruit will be in two pairs.

53.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

54.Mir Aneesuddin: Reclining on spreadings (like bed sheets, carpets etc.) the inner linings of which will be of silk brocade, and the fruits of the two gardens will be near.

55.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

56.Mir Aneesuddin: In both of them will be females who restrain their gaze, whom neither man nor jinn touched before them.

57.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

58.Mir Aneesuddin: As if they were rubies and corals.

59.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

60.Mir Aneesuddin: Is the reward of good (something) other than good?

61.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

62.Mir Aneesuddin: And besides these two, are two more gardens.

63.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

64.Mir Aneesuddin: Both, dark green in colour.

65.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny.

66.Mir Aneesuddin: In both of them are two springs gushing forth.

67.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

68.Mir Aneesuddin: In both of them are fruits and date palms and pomegranates.

69.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

70.Mir Aneesuddin: In both of them are good and beautiful ones.

71.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

72.Mir Aneesuddin: Fair ones, confined in pavilions.

73.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

74.Mir Aneesuddin: Whom neither man nor jinn touched before them.

75.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

76.Mir Aneesuddin: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful carpets.

77.Mir Aneesuddin: So which of the bounties of your Fosterer will you both deny?

78.Mir Aneesuddin: Blessed is the name of your Fosterer, Possessor of glory and honour.

56.SurahEnglishNames: The Event, The Inevitable, That Which is Coming

1.Mir Aneesuddin: When the event befalls,

2.Mir Aneesuddin: there is no falsehood in its befalling,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: (it will) bring down (some and) exalt (others).

4.Mir Aneesuddin: When the earth will be shaken (with) a shaking

5.Mir Aneesuddin: and the mountains will be crumbled (with) a crumbling,

6.Mir Aneesuddin: so that they will become as scattered dust.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: And you will become three kinds:

8.Mir Aneesuddin: So the companions of the right hand. How will the companions of the right hand be?

9.Mir Aneesuddin: And the companions of the left hand. How will the companions of the left hand be?

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And the foremost are the foremost.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: Those are the persons who will be brought near

12.Mir Aneesuddin: in gardens of bliss,

13.Mir Aneesuddin: numerous from among the ancients

14.Mir Aneesuddin: and less from among the later,

15.Mir Aneesuddin: (they will be) on couches encrusted (with gold and precious stones),

16.Mir Aneesuddin: reclining on them facing one another.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: Youths always staying (in attendance) will go around them

18.Mir Aneesuddin: with bowls and beakers and cups (filled with drinks) from a spring.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: They will not have headache from it nor will they be intoxicated.

20.Mir Aneesuddin: And (they will have) fruits from what they choose

21.Mir Aneesuddin: and flesh of birds from that which they desire,

22.Mir Aneesuddin: and fair ones with wide beautiful eyes

23.Mir Aneesuddin: resembling in likeness, hidden pearls,

24.Mir Aneesuddin: a reward for that which they used to do.

25.Mir Aneesuddin: They will hear therein nothing vain or sinful

26.Mir Aneesuddin: but the statement, “Peace! Peace!”

27.Mir Aneesuddin: And the companions of the right hand. How will the companions of the right hand be?

28.Mir Aneesuddin: (They will be) among thorn less lote trees,

29.Mir Aneesuddin: and clustered plantains,

30.Mir Aneesuddin: and extending shade,

31.Mir Aneesuddin: and water flowing continuously,

32.Mir Aneesuddin: and fruits in plenty,

33.Mir Aneesuddin: neither to be cut off nor forbidden,

34.Mir Aneesuddin: and raised beds.

35.Mir Aneesuddin: We have produced them (females, and they are such) creation

36.Mir Aneesuddin: that We have made them virgins,

37.Mir Aneesuddin: loving, equals in age

38.Mir Aneesuddin: for the companions of the right hand.

39.Mir Aneesuddin: Numerous from among the ancients,

40.Mir Aneesuddin: and numerous from among the later.

41.Mir Aneesuddin: And the companions of the left hand. How will the companions of the left hand be?

42.Mir Aneesuddin: (They will be) in hot wind and boiling water,

43.Mir Aneesuddin: and shadows of black smoke,

44.Mir Aneesuddin: neither cool nor beneficial.

45.Mir Aneesuddin: Before that (i.e. in the worldly life) they were well-off

46.Mir Aneesuddin: and they used to persist in great sin,

47.Mir Aneesuddin: and they used to say, “What! when we are dead and become (part of the) soil and bones, shall we indeed be raised (to life again),

48.Mir Aneesuddin: and our forefathers (too)?”

49.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Certainly, the ancients and the later,

50.Mir Aneesuddin: all will be gathered at the appointed time on the known day.”

51.Mir Aneesuddin: Then all of you ! O you who err and deny,

52.Mir Aneesuddin: you will eat from the tree of Zaqqum

53.Mir Aneesuddin: and fill your stomachs with it,

54.Mir Aneesuddin: then over it you will drink from boiling water

55.Mir Aneesuddin: and you will drink (as) a thirsty camel drinks.

56.Mir Aneesuddin: This will be their entertainment on the day of judgment.

57.Mir Aneesuddin: We have created you, then why do you not accept the truth?

58.Mir Aneesuddin: Have you seen (the sperm) which you emit?

59.Mir Aneesuddin: Is it you who have created it or are We the Creators?

60.Mir Aneesuddin: We have destined death among you, and We are not to be overcome

61.Mir Aneesuddin: in changing your likeness and producing you in (a state), the knowledge of which you do not have.

62.Mir Aneesuddin: And you indeed know the first creation, so why are you not mindful?

63.Mir Aneesuddin: Have you seen that which you sow?

64.Mir Aneesuddin: Is it you who grow (the plants through) it or are We the Growers?

65.Mir Aneesuddin: Had We willed, We could have made it broken pieces, then you would start wondering,

66.Mir Aneesuddin: “We are (involved) in a lasting difficulty,

67.Mir Aneesuddin: no, we are deprived.”

68.Mir Aneesuddin: Have you seen the water which you drink?

69.Mir Aneesuddin: Is it you who send it down from the cloud or are We those Who send it down?

70.Mir Aneesuddin: Had We willed We could have made it bitter, so why are you not grateful?

71.Mir Aneesuddin: Have you seen the fire which you kindle?

72.Mir Aneesuddin: Is it you who produce the tree for it or are We the Producers?

73.Mir Aneesuddin: We have made it a reminder (probably of hell fire) and a provision for the needy (wayfarer).

74.Mir Aneesuddin: So glorify the name of your Great Fosterer.

75.Mir Aneesuddin: So I do swear by the places of existence of the stars,

76.Mir Aneesuddin: and that certainly is a great oath, if you only knew.

77.Mir Aneesuddin: It is certainly an honoured Quran,

78.Mir Aneesuddin: in a book that is protected,

79.Mir Aneesuddin: none touch it except those who are clean,

80.Mir Aneesuddin: sent down from the Fosterer of the worlds.

81.Mir Aneesuddin: Then is it this statement which (is so important), that you take easy?

82.Mir Aneesuddin: And you make it your livelihood, that you (go on) denying it!

83.Mir Aneesuddin: So why is it not that when the (soul) reaches the throat,

84.Mir Aneesuddin: and you are at that time looking on (waiting),

85.Mir Aneesuddin: and We are nearer to the (dying person) than you, but not visible to you,

86.Mir Aneesuddin: so why is it not, if you are not bound by any law,

87.Mir Aneesuddin: (that you) bring the (soul) back, if you are truthful?

88.Mir Aneesuddin: Then if he is from among those near (to Allah),

89.Mir Aneesuddin: then (he will have) happiness and fragrance and the garden of bliss.

90.Mir Aneesuddin: And if he is from among the companions of the right hand,

91.Mir Aneesuddin: then (it will be said), “Peace for you, from those of the right hand.”

92.Mir Aneesuddin: And if he is from among the deniers who are in error,

93.Mir Aneesuddin: then the entertainment (for him) will be of boiling water

94.Mir Aneesuddin: and entry in hell.

95.Mir Aneesuddin: This indeed is the certain truth.

96.Mir Aneesuddin: So glorify the name of your Great Fosterer.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Whatever is in the skies and the earth glorifies Allah and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: His is the kingdom of the skies and the earth, He gives life and causes to die and He has power over everything.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: He is the First and the Last and the Evident (Outer Most) and the Hidden (Inner Most) and He is the Knower of everything.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: He it is Who created the skies and the earth in six periods, then He set the balance on the throne (of the universe). He knows that which enters into the earth and that which comes out of it and that which comes down from the sky and that which goes up into it. And He is with you wherever you are and Allah is the Seer of that which you do.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: His is the kingdom of the skies and the earth, and (all) affairs will be returned to Allah.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: He causes the night to enter into the day and He causes the day to enter into the night, and He is the Knower of what the bosoms (hearts) possess.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: Believe in Allah and His messenger and spend from that which He has made you to be successors of. So those who believe from among you and spend, for them there is a great reward.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: And what (reason is there) for you that you do not believe in Allah when His messenger invites you to believe in your Fosterer, and indeed He has taken a pledge from you, if you are believers?

9.Mir Aneesuddin: He it is Who sends down clear signs on His servant, that He may bring you out from darkness towards light and Allah is certainly full of pity. Merciful to you,

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And what (reason is there) for you, that you do not spend in the way of Allah, when Allah’s is the inheritance of the skies and the earth (that is, when everything will go back to Him)? Those among you who spent and fought before the victory (of Mecca) are not equal to, (but) are greater in rank compared to those who spent and fought after (the victory), and to each Allah has promised good, and Allah is informed of that which you do.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: Who is there who will loan to Allah a good loan so that He will double it for him and for him there will be an honourable reward?

12.Mir Aneesuddin: One day you will see the believing men and the believing women, their light running before them and on their right hand (side), good news to you this day: gardens beneath which rivers flow, for staying therein. That is the great achievement.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: That day the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women will say to those who believe, “Wait for us, that we may get light from your light,” it will be said, “Go back to your rear (past life if possible) then seek a light.” Then a wall will be set up between them for which there will be a gate, inside of it there will be mercy and on the outer side of it (there will be) punishment.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: The (hypocrites) will call out to the (believers), “Were we not with you?” They will say, “Why not! but you yourselves fell into temptation and you hesitated and doubted and your desires deceived you till the command of Allah came, and the deceiver deceived you concerning Allah.”

15.Mir Aneesuddin: So on that day no ransom will be accepted from you nor from those who did not believe, your settling place will be the fire, that is your (place of) turning back and it is an evil destination.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: Has not the time come for those who believe, that their hearts become humbled for the remembrance of Allah and that which Allah has sent down of the truth, and (that) they do not become like those who were given the book earlier? So, as the time passed on them their hearts hardened and many of them were transgressors.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: Know that Allah gives life to the earth after its death, He makes the signs clear for you that you may understand.

18.Mir Aneesuddin: The men who give charity and the women who give charity and loan to Allah a good loan. He will certainly double it for them and for them there will be an honourable reward.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who believe in Allah and His messengers, those are the persons who are truthful. And the witnesses (martyrs) are with their Fosterer, for them is their reward and their light. And those who do not believe and deny Our signs, they are the inhabitants of hell.

20.Mir Aneesuddin: Know that the life of this world is nothing but sport and pastime and pomp and boasting among yourselves and competition for increase in wealth and children, it is like rain, the growth of vegetation through which pleases the farmer, then it dries up and you see it become yellow, then it becomes broken pieces. And in the hereafter there is severe punishment and protective forgiveness and pleasure from Allah. And the life of this world is nothing but a deceptive provision.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: Be foremost in (seeking) protective forgiveness from your Fosterer and the garden, the extension of which is like the extension of the sky and the earth, prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers. That is the grace of Allah, He gives it to whom He wills and Allah is the Possessor of great grace.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: No disaster befalls in the earth nor among yourselves, but it is (recorded) in a book before We bring it into existence, that is certainly easy for Allah.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: (You are informed of this) so that you may not despair over (matters) which have gone out of your hands (i.e. your failures) nor be exultant because of that which He has given you (of success). And Allah does not like all those who are proud, boastful,

24.Mir Aneesuddin: who hoard (being niggardly) and enjoin mankind to hoard (being niggardly). And whoever turns away, then Allah is certainly Independent, the Praised.

25.Mir Aneesuddin: We indeed sent Our messengers with clear proofs and We sent down with them the book (law) and the balance (justice) that mankind may conduct themselves with justice, and We sent down the iron in which is severe strength  and other benefits for mankind; and that Allah may know (mark out) him who helps Him and His messengers without seeing (Him), Allah is certainly Strong, Mighty.

26.Mir Aneesuddin: And We indeed sent Nuh and Ibrahim and appointed the prophet hood and the book (to remain) in their descendants, so among them are those who are guided and many of them are transgressors.

27.Mir Aneesuddin: Then We made Our messengers to follow in their footsteps and We made Isa, the son of Maryam, to follow and gave him the Injeel, and placed compassion and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. And they invented monasticism*, We did not prescribe it for them, only to seek Allah’s pleasure, but they did not observe it with the observation due to it. So We gave to those who believed from among them, their reward, and most of them are transgressors. * Seclusion from worldly life. him. And they invented monasticism*, We did not prescribe it for them, only to seek Allah’s pleasure, but they did not observe it with the observation due to it. So We gave to those who believed from among them, their reward, and most of them are transgressors. * Seclusion from worldly life.

28.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe ! fear Allah and believe in His messenger, He will give you a double portion of His mercy and He will appoint for you a light through which you will walk and He will protectively forgive you and Allah is Protectively Forgiving, Merciful,

29.Mir Aneesuddin: that the owners of the book may know that they do not have control on anything from the grace of Allah and that the bounty is in Allah's hand, He gives it to whom He wills and Allah is the Possessor of great grace.

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah has heard the statement of her who pleads with you concerning her husband and complains to Allah, and Allah was hearing the conversation of you both, Allah is certainly Hearing, Seeing.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: Those of you who do not go near their wives calling them their mothers, they are not their mothers, their mothers are none other than those who gave them birth. And they certainly say something unrecognised (as good) in speech, and a lie, and Allah is certainly Pardoning, Protectively Forgiving.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who do not go near their wives calling them their mothers, then (afterwards if they intend to) go back on what they said, they should free a slave before they touch each other, that is what you are admonished with, and Allah is informed of what you do.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: But he who does not find (a slave) then he should fast for two months successively before they touch each other, but he who is not capable (to fast), should feed sixty needy ones. That (should be done, if you claim) that you believe in Allah and His messenger, and those are the limits of Allah. And there will be a painful punishment for the infidels. be a painful punishment for the infidels.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who resist Allah and His messenger will certainly be disgraced as those before them were disgraced. And We indeed sent down clear signs, and there will be a disgraceful punishment for the infidels.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: One day Allah will raise all of them (to life) then inform them about that which they did. Allah has computed it while they have forgotten it, and Allah is the Witness over everything.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: Did they not consider that Allah knows whatever is in the skies and whatever is in the earth. There is no secret talk (between) three but He is the fourth of them nor (between) five but He is the sixth of them , nor less than that nor more but He is with them wherever they are, then on the day of resurrection He will inform them about that which they did, Allah is certainly the Knower of everything.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: Did you not see towards those who were forbidden from secret talks, then (again) they return to that which they were forbidden, and they hold secret talks for sin and transgression and disobedience to the messenger. And when they come to you, they greet you with (a greeting) with which Allah does not greet you, and they say among themselves, “Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?” Hell is enough for them, they will enter it, so evil is (their) destination.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe ! when you hold secret talks, then do not hold (these) secret talks for sin and transgression and disobedience to the messenger, but hold secret talks for righteousness and guarding (against evil) and fear Allah towards Whom you will be gathered.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: The secret talks (i.e. the evil suggestions) of the devil are only to grieve those who believe but he cannot harm them in anything, except with Allah’s permission, so let the believers put their trust in Allah.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! when it is said to you “Make room in assemblies,” then make room, Allah will make room for you. And when it is said, “Rise up,” then rise up, Allah will exalt in degrees those who believe from among you and those who are given knowledge, and Allah is informed of that which you do.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! when you secretly consult the messenger, then give charity in advance, before your secret consultation (with him). That is better for you and cleaner, but if you do not find (anything to give in charity) then Allah is certainly Protectively Forgiving, Merciful.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: Are you afraid of giving charity in advance, before your secret consultation? So when you do not do it, and (when) Allah has turned to you (mercifully), then establish worship (salat) and give charity (zakat) and obey Allah and His messenger and Allah is informed of that which you do.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: Did you not consider those who turn (for friendship towards)a people on whom is Allah’s anger? They are neither of you nor of them and they swear over falsehood while they know.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah has prepared a severe punishment for them, that which they do is certainly evil.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: They take their oaths as a shelter (for their evil) and turn away (people) from the way of Allah, therefore, there will be a disgraceful punishment for them.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: Their wealth and their children will be of no use to them in anything against Allah, they are the inhabitants of the fire, they will stay therein.

18.Mir Aneesuddin: The day Allah will raise all of them (to life) then they will swear to Him as they swear to you and they will think that they are on something (firm by their swearing). Beware ! they are the liars.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: The devil has cast his influence over them so he has made them to forget the remembrance of Allah. Those are (the members of) the team of the devil. Beware! the (members of) the team of the devil, they are certainly the losers.

20.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who resist Allah and His messenger, they are certainly among the most disgraced.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah has decreed, “I and My messengers will definitely prevail.” Allah is certainly Strong, Mighty.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: You will not find a people who believe in Allah and the period hereafter, loving those who resist Allah and His messenger, even though they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their relatives (and friends). Those are the persons in whose hearts He has written down belief and has strengthened them with a spirit from Him. And He will make them enter gardens beneath which rivers flow, to stay therein, Allah pleased with them and they pleased with Him. Those are (the members of) the team of Allah. Beware ! (the members of) the team of Allah, they are the successful ones.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Whatever is in the skies and whatever is in the earth glorifies Allah and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: He it is Who caused the driving out of those who did not believe from among the owners of the book, from their houses at the first gathering for exile. You did not expect that they will go out while they expected that their fortresses would defend them against Allah, but Allah came to them (to punish them) from a place which they could not (even) imagine, and He cast terror into their hearts so that their houses were ruined with their own hands and the hands of the believers, so learn a lesson O you who have insight !

3.Mir Aneesuddin: And if Allah had not decreed exile for them He would have punished them in this world, and in the hereafter they will have the punishment of fire.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: That is because they opposed Allah and His messenger, and whoever opposes Allah then Allah is certainly severe in requiting.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: Whatever date palms you cut down or left them standing on their roots, it was by Allah’s permission, so that (through it) He might disgrace the transgressors.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: And whatever Allah made His messenger to take from them, you did not make any horse or riding camel to run for (achieving) it, but Allah gives authority to His messengers over whom He wills and Allah has power over everything.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: Whatever Allah made His messenger to take from the people of the towns, it is for Allah and for His messenger and for the possessors of relationship and the orphans and the needy and the wayfarer, so that the (wealth) may not become an item of circulation (only) between the rich among you. And take that which the messenger gives you and that which he withholds from you, you (too) withhold (yourselves from it), and fear Allah, Allah is certainly severe in requiting.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: (It is) for the poor immigrants who were driven out from their houses and their possessions, seeking the grace of Allah and His pleasure, and they helped Allah and His messenger, those are the persons who are truthful.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who were settled in houses (in Madina) and (in) belief, before the (migrants from Mecca), they love those who migrated towards them and do not find in their hearts any need of that which is given to the (migrants) and prefer them over themselves even if they are in need, and one who is saved from the selfishness of his soul, then those are the persons who are successful.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who came after them say, “Our Fosterer ! protectively forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in belief and do not let any ill feeling be present in our hearts for those who believe. Our Fosterer ! You are certainly full of pity, Merciful.”

11.Mir Aneesuddin: Did you not see those hypocrites who say to their brothers who do not believe from among the owners of the book, “If you are driven out we (too) will definitely go out with you and we will never obey anyone against you and if you are attacked in fighting, we will definitely help you.” And Allah is a Witness that they are certainly liars.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: If they are driven out they will not go out with them and if they are attacked in fighting they will not help them and if (at all) they help them, they will definitely turn their backs, then they will not be helped. help them, they will definitely turn their backs, then they will not be helped.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: Terror on account of you is stronger in their hearts than that due to Allah, that is because they are a people who do not understand.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: (Even) all of them combined together will not fight with you, except (after taking shelter) in fortified towns or from behind walls, their fighting among themselves is severe, you think that they are united whereas their hearts are disunited, that is because they are people who have no sense.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: (They are) similar in likeness to those who were just before them (and) who tasted the evil result of their affair, and for them there is a painful punishment.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: (They are) similar in likeness to the devil when he says to man, “Reject (the truth),” but when he rejects, he says, “I am free of you I am certainly afraid of Allah, the Fosterer of the worlds.”

17.Mir Aneesuddin: Therefore the end of both will be that, both of them will be in the fire, staying therein, and that is the reward of those who are unjust.

18.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe ! fear Allah, and let every soul look to what it has sent in advance for the morrow (future) and fear Allah, Allah is certainly informed of that which you do.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: And do not be like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves, those are the persons who transgress.

20.Mir Aneesuddin: Inhabitants of the fire and inhabitants of the garden are not equal, the inhabitants of the garden, they are the achievers.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: If We had sent down this Quran on a mountain, you would have seen it fallen down splitting asunder due to the fear of Allah. And these are similitude’s We set forth for mankind that they may reflect*. * See note under Chapter 25, Verse 32.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah is He, besides Whom there is no god, Knower of the unseen and the seen, He is the Beneficent, the Merciful.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah is He, besides Whom there is no god, the King, the Holy, the Author of peace, the Granter of security, the Guardian, the Mighty, the Compeller, the Possessor of greatness; glorified be Allah above what they associate as partners (with Him).

24.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah is He (Who is) the Creator, the Purifier, the Fashioner, His are the most beautiful names, whatever is in the skies and the earth glorifies Him and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! do not take My enemy and your enemy as friends offering them love while they reject that which has come to you of the truth, driving out the messenger and you (just) because you believe in Allah your Fosterer. If you have come out for striving in My way and seeking My pleasure (why) do you offer them love in secret? And I know best that which you hide and that which you make public. And whoever from among you does that, then he has indeed gone astray from the balanced way.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: If they dominate you, they will be your enemies, and they will stretch towards you their hands and their tongues with evil, and they like that you (too should) reject (the truth).

3.Mir Aneesuddin: Your blood relatives and your children will not be of any benefit to you on the day of resurrection, He will decide between you, and Allah is the Seer of that which you do.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: There is indeed a good example for you to follow, in Ibrahim and those with him when they said to their people, “We are free of you and that which you worship besides Allah, we do not believe with you, and enmity and hatred has become manifest between us and you for ever, unless you (too) believe in Allah Who is One,” but for the word of Ibrahim to his father, “I will definitely ask protective forgiveness for you though I do not control for you anything from Allah. Our Fosterer! in You do we put our trust and towards You do we turn and towards You is the destination.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: Our Fosterer ! do not make us (an item of) trial for those who do not believe and protect us, our Fosterer! You are certainly the Mighty, the Wise.”

6.Mir Aneesuddin: There is certainly a good example in them for you to follow, for him who hopes (facing) Allah and the period hereafter; and he who turns away, then Allah is certainly Independent, the Praised.  ereafter; and he who turns away, then Allah is certainly Independent, the Praised.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: It may be that Allah will (inspire) love between you and those of them who are your enemies, and Allah is Powerful and Allah is Protectively Forgiving, Merciful.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah does not forbid you, with regard to those who do not fight with you on account of (your) religion nor drive you out of your houses, (from) being kind to them and dealing justly with them, Allah certainly loves those who are just.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah forbids you, only with regard to those who fight with you on account of (your) religion and drive you out of your houses and help (others) in driving you out,(from) making friendship with them, and whoever makes friendship with them, then those are the persons who are unjust.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe ! when believing immigrant women come to you then examine them, Allah knows best their belief, but if you (too) know them to be believers then do not return them to the infidels, they are not lawful for them nor the (infidels) are lawful for them and give the (infidels) that which they have spent (on them), and there is no sin on you to marry them when you give them their dowries. And do not retain the ties of marriage with the infidel women. And ask for (the return of) that which you have spent and let them ask for (the return of) that which they have spent, that is the judgment of Allah (with which) He judges between you and Allah is Knowing, Wise.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: And if anything through your wives (who deserted you) has gone from you to the infidels, then when your turn comes (and you receive wealth from the infidels, then) give to those whose wives have gone, the like of that which they had spent, and fear Allah, in Whom you believe.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: O prophet! when believing women come to you to take an oath of allegiance unto you that they will not associate anything with Allah and they will not steal and they will not commit adultery and they will not kill their children and they will not come with a false charge (on someone), forging it between their hands and their feet, and they will not disobey you in (what) is recognised (as good), then accept their allegiance and ask Allah for their protective forgiveness, Allah is certainly Protectively Forgiving, Merciful.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! do not make friendship with a people on whom is Allah’s anger, they are indeed in despair about the hereafter as the infidels are in despair about those who are in graves.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Whatever is in the skies and whatever is in the earth glorifies Allah and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! why do you say that which you do not do?

3.Mir Aneesuddin: It is most hateful to Allah that you say that which you do not do.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah certainly loves those who fight in His way in ranks as if they were a solid structure.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: And (remember) when Musa said to his people, “O my people! why do you annoy me when you indeed know that I am a messenger of Allah (sent) to you?” So when they deviated from the right Allah (also) deviated their hearts from the right and Allah does not guide a transgressing people.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: And (remember) when Isa, the son of Maryam, said, “O children of Israel! I am a messenger of Allah (sent) to you, confirming that which is before me of the Torah and conveying the good news of a messenger who will come after me, his name being Ahmed (Muhammed).” But when he came to them with clear proofs, they said, “This is clear magic.”

7.Mir Aneesuddin: And who is more unjust than he who forges a lie against Allah when he is invited towards Islam? And Allah does not guide an unjust people.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: They intend to put out the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah will perfect His light even though the infidels may dislike.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: He it is Who has sent His messenger with guidance and the religion of truth that He may make it prevail over every (other) religion, even though the polytheists may dislike.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! shall I lead you to a commerce that will save you from the painful punishment?

11.Mir Aneesuddin: You believe in Allah and His messenger and strive in the way of Allah with your wealth and your persons, that is better for you if you (could only) know.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: He will protectively forgive you your sins and make you enter gardens beneath which rivers flow, and pleasant dwellings in gardens of everlasting bliss, that is a great achievement.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: And another (reward) which you love, help from Allah and a near victory, and convey good news to the believers.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! be helpers of Allah: as Isa, the son of Maryam, had said to the disciples, “Who are my helpers in (the cause of) Allah?” The disciples said, “We are the helpers of Allah.” So a party of the children of Israel believed and a party did not believe. Then We strengthened those who believed, against their enemy, so they became victorious.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Whatever is in the skies and whatever is in the earth, glorifies Allah, the King, the Holy, the Mighty, the Wise.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: He it is Who raised among the unlettered, a messenger from among them, he recites to them His signs and purifies them and teaches them the book (the law) and the wisdom, (interpretation of the law) and earlier they were in clear error,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: and (will do so to) others (too) from among those who have not yet joined them. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: That is the grace of Allah, He gives it to whom He wills, and Allah is the Possessor of great grace.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: The likeness of those who were (entrusted) with the burden (of implementing) the Torah then they did not bear this burden, is like the likeness of a donkey which bears the burden of books. Evil is the likeness of the people who deny the signs of Allah. And Allah does not guide the unjust people.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “O you who are Jews ! if you claim that you are the friends of Allah to the exclusion of other human beings, then desire for death, if you are truthful.”

7.Mir Aneesuddin: But they will never desire for it because of that which their hands have sent in advance, and Allah is the Knower of those who are unjust.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “The death from which you run away will certainly meet you, then you will be turned towards the Knower of the unseen and the seen and He will inform you of that which you used to do.”

9.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe ! when you are called for the congregational worship (salat) on Friday, hasten towards the remembrance of Allah and leave off trading (all business), that is better for you, if you (could only) know.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: Then when you complete the worship (salat), disperse in the earth and seek from Allah’s grace, and remember Allah much that you may be successful.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: And when they see any commerce or pastime, they disperse towards it and leave you standing. Say, “That which is with Allah is better than pastime and commerce and Allah is the Best of providers.”

1.Mir Aneesuddin: When the hypocrites come to you they say, “We bear witness that you are certainly a messenger of Allah.” And Allah knows that you are certainly His messenger and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are certainly liars (because they do not mean what they say).

2.Mir Aneesuddin: They make their oaths a shelter (and) thus turn away (people) from the way of Allah, evil is that which they do.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: That is because they believed then became infidels, so a seal was set on their hearts, therefore they do not understand.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: And when you see them, their personalities please you and if they speak, you listen to their speech. They are like beams of wood covered with (attractive) garments, they think that every loud cry is against them, they are the enemies, so beware of them. May Allah kill them, how they are turned away (from the truth)! are turned away (from the truth)!

5.Mir Aneesuddin: And when it is said to them, “Come, the messenger of Allah will seek protective forgiveness for you,” they turn their heads and you see them turning away and they consider themselves great.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: It is equal for them, whether you seek protective forgiveness for them or do not seek protective forgiveness for them, Allah will never forgive them. Allah certainly does not guide the transgressing people.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: They are the persons who say, “Do not spend on those who are with the messenger of Allah until they leave (him),” though the treasures of the skies and the earth are Allah’s but the hypocrites do not understand.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: 'They say, “If we return to Madina, the mightier will definitely drive out the weaker,” though might belongs to Allah and His messenger and the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! do not let your wealth and your children divert you from the remembrance of Allah, and whoever does that, then those are the persons at loss.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And spend from that which We have provided you, before death comes to one of you (and) then he says, “My Fosterer! why do you not postpone (this) for me till a near term so that I could give charity and become one of the righteous?”

11.Mir Aneesuddin: And Allah never postpones (death for) any soul when its term comes (to an end), and Allah is informed of that which you do.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Whatever is in the skies and whatever is in the earth glorifies Allah, His is the kingdom and to Him is due (all) praise and He has power over everything.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: He it is Who created you, but one of you is an infidel and one of you is a believer, and Allah is a Seer of that which you do.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: He created the skies and the earth in reality, and He gave you form and made your forms good, and towards Him is the destination.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: He knows whatever is in the skies and the earth and He knows that which you hide and that which you make public and Allah is the Knower of what the bosoms (hearts) possess.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: Has not the news come to you of those who did not believe before (you)? So they tasted the evil result of their affair and for them there is a painful punishment.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: That was because there came to them their messengers with clear proofs but they said, “Shall human beings guide us?” So they became infidels and turned away, therefore Allah (too) became unconcerned and Allah is Independent, Praised.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who do not believe, claim that they will never be raised (after their death). Say, “Why not! by my Fosterer! you will definitely be raised, then you will be informed of that which you did and that is easy for Allah.”
