8.Mir Aneesuddin: So believe in Allah and His messenger and the light which We have sent down and Allah is informed of that which you do.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: The day He will gather you for the day of gathering, that will be the day of manifestation of misappropriations. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteous work, He will remove from him his evil deeds and He will make him enter gardens beneath which rivers flow, for staying therein for ever. That is the great achievement.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who do not believe and deny Our signs, those are the inhabitants of the fire, they will stay therein and it is an evil destination.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: No disaster befalls except by Allah’s permission and whoever believes in Allah, He guides his heart and Allah is the Knower of everything.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: And obey Allah and obey the messenger but if you turn away then the responsibility of Our messenger is only to convey (the message) clearly.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah, there is no god except Him, so let the believers put their trust in Allah.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe! some of your wives and your children are certainly your enemies, so be cautious of them, and if you pardon and overlook and protectively forgive, then Allah (too) is Protectively Forgiving, Merciful.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: Your wealth and your children are only a trial, and there is a great reward with Allah.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: So fear Allah as much as you can and listen and obey and spend, that is better for your souls; and one who is saved from the selfishness of his soul, then those are the persons who are successful.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: If you loan to Allah a good loan, He will double it for you and He will protectively forgive you, and Allah is One Who acknowledges Clement (Gentle).

18.Mir Aneesuddin: Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Mighty, the Wise.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: O prophet! when you divorce women then divorce them for their prescribed term and calculate the prescribed term and fear Allah your Fosterer. Do not drive them out from their houses nor should they themselves go out, unless they commit an open indecency. And those are the limits of Allah and whoever transgresses the limits of Allah, he has indeed been unjust to his own soul, you do not know, perhaps Allah may bring about an event (of reunion) after that.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: So when they reach (the end of) their term, then either hold them in a recognised (good manner) or separate them in a recognised (good manner). And call to witness two just men from among you and establish (correct) evidence for (the sake of) Allah. With that is advised he who believes in Allah and the period hereafter, and whoever fears Allah He will make for him a way out,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: and He will provide him from a place unthought of. And whoever puts his trust in Allah, then He is sufficient for him. Allah certainly fulfils His command, Allah has indeed made a programme for everything.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: And for those of your women who have passed the age of menstruation, if you have a doubt, then their prescribed term is three months, and for those (too) who have not (yet started to) menstruate. And for the pregnant women, their prescribed term is till they lay down their burden. And whoever fears Allah, He makes his affair easy for him.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: That is the commandment of Allah, He has sent it down to you. And whoever fears Allah, He will remove from him his evil deeds and enlarge for him the reward.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: Make the (divorced) women dwell (during the prescribed term) where you dwell, according to your means, and do not harm them so as to cause distress to them. And if they are pregnant then spend on them till they lay down their burden, then if they suckle (the child) for you then give them their due payment and consult among yourselves in a recognised (good manner) and if you face some difficulty, then let another (woman) suckle (the child) for him (the responsibility of payment being on the father).

7.Mir Aneesuddin: Let him who has abundance spend out of his abundance, and one who has his provision straitened on him, let him spend from that which Allah has given to him. Allah does not task a soul but (to the extent of) that which He has given it. Allah will make (things) easy after difficulty.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: And how many a town revolted against the commandment of its Fosterer and His messengers, so We called it to account (that too) a severe account and We punished it (with) a severe punishment.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: So it tasted the evil result of its affair and at the end of its affair, there was loss.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah has prepared a severe punishment for them, so fear Allah, O men of understanding who believe ! Allah has sent down to you a reminder

11.Mir Aneesuddin: (through) a messenger who recites to you clear signs of Allah, so as to bring out those who believe and do righteous works, from darkness towards light. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteous work, He will make him enter gardens beneath which rivers flow, to stay therein for ever. Allah has made a better provision for him.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah is He Who created the seven skies (seven higher levels), and of the earth (seven lower levels) similar to those (of the skies) . The commandment (of Allah) comes down among them that you may know that Allah has power over everything and that Allah has encompassed everything in (His) knowledge.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: O prophet! why do you hold unlawful that which Allah has made lawful for you, seeking to please your wives, and Allah is Protectively Forgiving, Merciful.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah has indeed appointed for you (the procedure for the) dissolution of your oaths*, and Allah is your Guardian and He is the Knowing, the Wise. Chapter 5, Verse 89

3.Mir Aneesuddin: And when the prophet secretly (communicated details of) an event to one of his wives, but when she informed (others) about it and Allah made it known to him, he made known (to her, in turn) a part of it and avoided a part. So when he informed her about it she said, “Who informed you of this?” He said, “The Knower, the Informed, gave me the news.” part of it and avoided a part. So when he informed her about it she said, “Who informed you of this?” He said, “The Knower, the Informed, gave me the news.”

4.Mir Aneesuddin: If both of you turn to Allah (in repentance), then indeed your hearts are inclined, and if you help each other against him, then certainly Allah is his Guardian and Jibreel and the righteous believers and besides that, the angels (are there for his) help.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: Maybe his Fosterer, if he divorces you, will give him in your place, wives better than you:(Those who are) submissive, believing, obeying, penitent, worshipping, fasting, widows and virgins.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe ! save yourselves and your people from a fire, the fuel of which is human beings and stones, over it are angels stern, severe, who do not disobey Allah in that which He commands them (to do) and they do as they are commanded.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who do not believe ! do not make (any) excuse this day, you will be rewarded only for that which you used to do.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who believe ! turn towards Allah with sincere repentance, perhaps your Fosterer will remove from you (the effect of) your evil deeds and make you enter gardens beneath which rivers flow, on the day when Allah will not disgrace the prophet and those who believed with him, their light will be running before them and on their right hands, they will say, “Our Fosterer ! perfect our light for us and protectively forgive us, You certainly have power over everything.”

9.Mir Aneesuddin: O prophet ! strive against the infidels and the hypocrites and be stern with them, and their settling place is hell and it is an evil destination.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah sets forth an example for those who do not believe: the wife of Nuh and the wife of Lut, they were under Our two servants from among Our righteous servants but they betrayed them, so (their being wives of prophets) could not make them free from any (punishment) from Allah and it was said, “Enter the fire with those who enter.” it was said, “Enter the fire with those who enter.”

11.Mir Aneesuddin: And Allah sets forth an example for those who believe: the wife of Firawn when she said, “My Fosterer! build for me a house in Your nearness in the garden and deliver me from Firawn and his work and deliver me from the unjust people.”

12.Mir Aneesuddin: And Maryam, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into it (her body), from Our spirit and she testified to the truth of the words other Fosterer and His books and she was among the obedient ones.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Blessed is He in Whose hand is the kingdom (of the universe) and He has power over everything,

2.Mir Aneesuddin: Who created death and life to test you (as to) which of you is best in deeds, and He is the Mighty, the Protectively Forgiving,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: Who created the seven skies (higher levels) in accordance with each other, you do not see in the creation of the Beneficent (Allah) any discordance, then look again. Do you see any rifts (discontinuity)?

4.Mir Aneesuddin: Then look again and yet again, your sight will return to you defeated (in its purpose) and it will be tired.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: And We adorned the sky of the world with lamps and We made them missiles for the devils and We have prepared for them the punishment of blazing fire.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: And for those who do not believe in their Fosterer, is the punishment of hell and it is an evil destination.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: When they will be thrown into it, they will hear its roaring and it will blaze,

8.Mir Aneesuddin: almost bursting with fury. Whenever a batch is thrown into it, its guards will ask them, “Did no warner come to you?”

9.Mir Aneesuddin: They will say, “Why not! a warner had indeed come to us, but we denied and we said: Allah has not sent down anything, you are in nothing but great error.”

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And they will say, “Had we but listened or understood, we would not have been among the inhabitants of blazing fire.”

11.Mir Aneesuddin: So they will confess their sins, therefore away with the inhabitants of the blazing fire.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: Those who fear their Fosterer without having seen (Him), for them there is certainly protective forgiveness and a great reward.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: And (whether) you hide your word or manifest it, He is the Knower of what the bosoms (hearts) possess.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: Will He Who created not know, when He is the Subtilely Informed?

15.Mir Aneesuddin: He it is Who has made the earth subdued for you, so move about in its surroundings and eat from His provision and to Him will be the return after death.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: Or are you secure from Him Who is in the sky, that He will (not) make the earth sink with you when it is repeatedly shaken (during an earth quake)?

17.Mir Aneesuddin: Or are you secure from Him Who is in the sky, that He will (not) send on you a sandstorm (or volcanic debris)? Then you will know how My warning was.

18.Mir Aneesuddin: And those before them indeed denied, then how was My rejection (of them)?

19.Mir Aneesuddin: Or did they not see towards the birds above them, spreading and contracting (their wings)? No one holds them except the Beneficent (Allah), He is certainly the Seer of everything.

20.Mir Aneesuddin: Or who is it that will act as an army for you to help you, besides the Beneficent (Allah)? The infidels are in nothing but deception.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: Or who is it who will provide for you if He withholds His provision? No, they persist in revolt and hatred.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: Then, is he who walks headlong on his face better guided or he who walks balanced (on his feet and) on the straight path?

23.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “He it is Who produced you and made for you (the faculties of) hearing and seeing and the hearts, little is the gratitude you show.”

24.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “He it is Who has multiplied (and spread) you in the earth and towards Him you will be gathered.”

25.Mir Aneesuddin: And they say, “When will this promise (be fulfilled) if you are truthful?”

26.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “The knowledge (of it) is only with Allah and I am only a clear warner.”

27.Mir Aneesuddin: So when they see it near, the faces of those who did not believe will be grieved and it will be said, “This is what you used to ask for.”

28.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Have you considered, Allah can destroy me and those with me or be merciful to us, but who will protect the infidels from the painful punishment?”

29.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “He is the Beneficent, we believe in Him and put our trust in Him, so you will come to know who it is that is in clear error.”

30.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Have you considered, if your water were to go down, then who will bring flowing water?”

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Noon. By the pen and that which they write (with it),

2.Mir Aneesuddin: by the grace of your Fosterer you are not under the influence of the jinn.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: And there is certainly a reward for you, which will never fail.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: And you are certainly of an exalted character.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: So you will see and they (too) will see (as to)

6.Mir Aneesuddin: which of you is afflicted (with madness).

7.Mir Aneesuddin: Your Fosterer certainly knows best him who has gone astray from His way and He knows best those who receive guidance.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: So do not obey the liars,

9.Mir Aneesuddin: they like that you should compromise, so that they (too) would compromise.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And do not obey any disgraceful person who swears much,

11.Mir Aneesuddin: defamer, going about spreading slander,

12.Mir Aneesuddin: forbidder of good, exceeder of limits, sinful,

13.Mir Aneesuddin: merciless, besides that, mean,

14.Mir Aneesuddin: because he possesses wealth and sons.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: When Our signs are recited to him, he says, “Stories of the ancient.”

16.Mir Aneesuddin: We will brand him on the nose.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: We tried them as We tried the inhabitants of the garden when they swore that they would pluck its fruit in the morning,

18.Mir Aneesuddin: and they did not like to keep aside (a portion for the poor).

19.Mir Aneesuddin: So there went around it, a circuit (of disaster) from your Fosterer while they were asleep,

20.Mir Aneesuddin: so that the (garden) became as if (it was already) plucked.

21.Mir Aneesuddin: And they cried out to each other in the morning,

22.Mir Aneesuddin: saying, “Go to your field in the morning, if you are to pluck (the fruits).”

23.Mir Aneesuddin: So they went whispering to one another,

24.Mir Aneesuddin: that, “No poor man shall enter it today (to beg) from you.”

25.Mir Aneesuddin: And (when they went) in the morning, (they presumed that) they had power on their determination (to pluck the fruit),

26.Mir Aneesuddin: but when they saw it, they said, “We are certainly in error,

27.Mir Aneesuddin: no, we are those who have been deprived (of receiving the benefit of our labour).”

28.Mir Aneesuddin: One balanced among them said, “Did I not tell you? Had you glorified (by regarding Allah above all, this would not have happened).”

29.Mir Aneesuddin: They said, “Glorified be our Fosterer, we were certainly unjust.”

30.Mir Aneesuddin: Then they turned, some blaming the others.

31.Mir Aneesuddin: They said, “Sorrowful is our state, we were rebellious,

32.Mir Aneesuddin: it may be that our Fosterer will give us in exchange, a better (garden) than this; to our Fosterer (we turn as) seekers (of His grace).”

33.Mir Aneesuddin: Such was the punishment, and the punishment of the hereafter is greater, had they but known.

34.Mir Aneesuddin: For those who guard (against evil), there will certainly be gardens of bliss with their Fosterer.

35.Mir Aneesuddin: Shall We make those who submit (as Muslims), like the criminals?

36.Mir Aneesuddin: What is (wrong) with you? How do you judge?

37.Mir Aneesuddin: Or have you a book through which you learn,

38.Mir Aneesuddin: that you shall have therein what you choose?

39.Mir Aneesuddin: Or do you have an agreement from Us which extends till the day of resurrection that you will have what you order (for)?

40.Mir Aneesuddin: Ask them, which of them will be a claimant of that.

41.Mir Aneesuddin: Or have they partners? Then let them bring their partners if they are truthful.

42.Mir Aneesuddin: On the day (the covering) will be removed from the ankle (there being a calamity), and they will be called for prostrations, but they will not be able to (prostrate),

43.Mir Aneesuddin: their looks will be humbled, disgrace will cover them. And indeed they used to be called for prostrations when they were sound, (but they used to refuse).

44.Mir Aneesuddin: So leave Me and him who denies this statement, We will gradually catch them from such a position that they will not know.

45.Mir Aneesuddin: And I give them time, My plot is certainly firm.

46.Mir Aneesuddin: Do you ask them for a reward so that they are burdened with a lasting difficulty?

47.Mir Aneesuddin: Or is (the knowledge of) the unseen with them, so that they write (it) down?

48.Mir Aneesuddin: So wait patiently for the command of your Fosterer and do not be like the companion of the fish (Yunus) when he called out while he was in grief.

49.Mir Aneesuddin: Had the favour of his Fosterer not reached him, he would have been (left) cast on the naked shore while he was blamed.

50.Mir Aneesuddin: Then his Fosterer chose him and made him of the righteous.

51.Mir Aneesuddin: And those who do not believe, when they hear the reminder, (give such an impression) by their looks that they would almost pull you down from your position and say, “He is indeed under the influence of the jinn.”

52.Mir Aneesuddin: And this is nothing but a reminder to the worlds.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: The truth!

2.Mir Aneesuddin: What is the truth?

3.Mir Aneesuddin: And what will make you realize what the truth is?

4.Mir Aneesuddin: Samood and Aad denied the disaster.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: So as for Samood, they were destroyed by the thunder and lightning.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: And as for Aad, they were destroyed by a violently furious wind,

7.Mir Aneesuddin: which He imposed on them for seven nights and eight days continuously, so that you could see people lying therein, overthrown as if they were the hollow trunks of date palms.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: So do you see anyone of them remaining?

9.Mir Aneesuddin: And Firawn and those before him and the overthrown cities, (all) were involved in faults,

10.Mir Aneesuddin: so they disobeyed the messenger of their Fosterer therefore He seized them with a severe seizure.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: When the water overflowed We carried you in the ship,

12.Mir Aneesuddin: so as to make it a reminder for you and that remembering ears may keep it in memory.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: So when it will be blown into the trumpet (structure of the universe, with) a single blowing,

14.Mir Aneesuddin: and the earth will be carried away with the mountains then crushed to pieces with a single crushing,

15.Mir Aneesuddin: then on that day the event will befall.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: And the sky will be split asunder, so that day it will be weak .

17.Mir Aneesuddin: And the angels will be on its sides, and on that day, eight will bear the throne of your Fosterer above them.

18.Mir Aneesuddin: On that day all of you will be presented, no secret of yours will be hidden.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: So, as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, “Take read my record,

20.Mir Aneesuddin: I was expecting that I would certainly encounter my account (of deeds).”

21.Mir Aneesuddin: So he will be in a pleasant life,

22.Mir Aneesuddin: in a high garden,

23.Mir Aneesuddin: the clusters of which will be near.

24.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be said to him), “Eat and drink pleasantly because of that which you sent before you during the days that are gone (i.e. during the life of the world).”

25.Mir Aneesuddin: And as for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, “I wish my record had not been given to me,

26.Mir Aneesuddin: and I had not known what my account (of deeds) was,

27.Mir Aneesuddin: 1 wish the (death) had made an end of me,

28.Mir Aneesuddin: my wealth has not made me carefree from (this),

29.Mir Aneesuddin: my authority has gone away from me.”

30.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be said), “Catch him then chain him,

31.Mir Aneesuddin: then make him enter the hell,

32.Mir Aneesuddin: then make him to enter into a chain, the length of which is seventy cubits*. * The length of the forearm from the elbow to the extremity of the middle finger.

33.Mir Aneesuddin: He had not believed in Allah, the Great

34.Mir Aneesuddin: and he had not urged on the feeding of the poor

35.Mir Aneesuddin: so he (too) this day, has no intimate friend here

36.Mir Aneesuddin: nor any food except the corruption from the washings of wounds,

37.Mir Aneesuddin: none will eat it except the defaulters.”

38.Mir Aneesuddin: So I do swear by that which you see

39.Mir Aneesuddin: and that which you do not see (that):

40.Mir Aneesuddin: This (Quran) is certainly the word of an honoured messenger,

41.Mir Aneesuddin: and it is not a word of a poet, little is it that you believe,

42.Mir Aneesuddin: and it is not a word of a soothsayer, little is it that you mind,

43.Mir Aneesuddin: (it has been) sent down from the Fosterer of the worlds.

44.Mir Aneesuddin: And had he said some words about Us on his own behalf (and attributed them to Us, then),

45.Mir Aneesuddin: We would have seized him by his right hand

46.Mir Aneesuddin: then We would have cut off the artery of his heart,

47.Mir Aneesuddin: and not one of you could have withheld Us from him.

48.Mir Aneesuddin: And it is certainly a reminder for those who guard (against evil).

49.Mir Aneesuddin: And We certainly know that among you are deniers.

50.Mir Aneesuddin: And it will certainly be (a source of) regret for the infidels.

51.Mir Aneesuddin: And surely it is the truth (deserving) certainty.

52.Mir Aneesuddin: So glorify the name of your Great Fosterer.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: A questioner asked about the punishment to fall.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: For the infidels, there will be no defender for it.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: (It will be) from Allah, Possessor of the ways of ascent.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: The angels and the spirit ascend to Him, in a day (period), the measure of which is fifty thousand years.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: So be patient with the patience that is good.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: They certainly see it far,

7.Mir Aneesuddin: while We see it near.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: The day when the sky will become like molten brass

9.Mir Aneesuddin: and the mountains will be like coloured wool

10.Mir Aneesuddin: and (even) an intimate friend will not inquire from another intimate friend

11.Mir Aneesuddin: (though) they will be made to see each other. The criminal would love to ransom himself from the punishment of that day by (sacrificing even) his sons,

12.Mir Aneesuddin: and his wife and his brother

13.Mir Aneesuddin: and his family which gave him shelter,

14.Mir Aneesuddin: and whosoever is in the earth, all, (and) then save himself.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: By no means ! it is certainly a flaming fire

16.Mir Aneesuddin: taking off the skin.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: It will invite him who turned back (from the truth) and went away

18.Mir Aneesuddin: and amassed (wealth) then withheld (it).

19.Mir Aneesuddin: Man is certainly hasty (by) character;

20.Mir Aneesuddin: when evil afflicts him he is impatient

21.Mir Aneesuddin: and when good (even) touches him (he) is niggardly

22.Mir Aneesuddin: except the worshippers (those who offer salat)

23.Mir Aneesuddin: who are constant at their worship (salat)

24.Mir Aneesuddin: and in whose wealth there is a known (portion as the) right

25.Mir Aneesuddin: of one who asks and of one who is deprived (yet does not ask);

26.Mir Aneesuddin: and those who accept the truth of the day of judgment

27.Mir Aneesuddin: and those who are fearful of the punishment of their Fosterer,

28.Mir Aneesuddin: the punishment of their Fosterer is certainly (something from which) one should not feel secure;

29.Mir Aneesuddin: and those who guard their private parts

30.Mir Aneesuddin: except from their wives or whom their right hands possess, so in their case they are not to be blamed,

31.Mir Aneesuddin: but whoever seeks (something) beyond that, then those are the persons who are transgressors;

32.Mir Aneesuddin: and those who are faithful to their trusts and their agreements;

33.Mir Aneesuddin: and those who stand firm on their testimonies;

34.Mir Aneesuddin: and those who are custodians of their worship (salat).

35.Mir Aneesuddin: They will be honoured in gardens.

36.Mir Aneesuddin: So what is the matter with those who do not believe that they rush towards you

37.Mir Aneesuddin: from your right and from your left, in groups?

38.Mir Aneesuddin: Does every man among them hope that he will be made to enter the garden of bliss?

39.Mir Aneesuddin: By no means ! they know (the thing) from which We created them.

40.Mir Aneesuddin: So I do swear by the Fosterer of the rising places/times and setting places/times (of the sun), that We are certainly able

41.Mir Aneesuddin: to replace (them by others) better than them and We are not to be overcome.

42.Mir Aneesuddin: So leave them involved in idle talk and play, till they meet their day which they are promised.

43.Mir Aneesuddin: The day they will come out from their graves in haste, as if rushing towards a goal,

44.Mir Aneesuddin: (with) their eyes humbled, disgrace covering them, that is the day which they were promised.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: We had sent Nuh to his people, (saying), “Warn your people before a painful punishment comes on them.”

2.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “O my people ! I am a clear warner to you:

3.Mir Aneesuddin: that you should serve (worship) Allah and fear Him and obey me,

4.Mir Aneesuddin: He will (for give and) protect you from your sins and give you time till an appointed term. When the term of Allah comes (to an end), it will certainly not be postponed, had you but known.”

5.Mir Aneesuddin: He said, “My Fosterer! I invited my people (towards You) night and day

6.Mir Aneesuddin: but my invitation did not increase in them anything except running away (from the truth).

7.Mir Aneesuddin: And whenever I invited them that You will protectively forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears and covered, themselves with garments and persisted (in refusing) and considered themselves great (due to) pride.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: Then I invited them aloud,

9.Mir Aneesuddin: then I invited them publicly and secretly in private,

10.Mir Aneesuddin: then I said: Seek protective forgiveness of your Fosterer, He is certainly Protectively Forgiving,

11.Mir Aneesuddin: He will send on you abundant rain from the sky,

12.Mir Aneesuddin: and will help you with wealth and sons and He will make gardens for you and He will make rivers for you.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: What is (wrong) with you, do you not expect Allah to be serious (about the above promises)?

14.Mir Aneesuddin: And He has created you (through) different stages.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: Did you not consider how Allah created the seven skies (higher levels) in accordance with each other,

16.Mir Aneesuddin: and made the moon therein (a source of reflected) light and made the sun a lamp?

17.Mir Aneesuddin: And Allah caused you to grow from the earth (as a) growth,

18.Mir Aneesuddin: then He returns you into it and He will bring you out, a bringing out.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: And Allah has made the earth a wide expanse for you,

20.Mir Aneesuddin: that you may move therein on wide ways.”

21.Mir Aneesuddin: Nuh said, “My Fosterer, they disobeyed me, and followed him whose wealth and children added to him nothing but loss.

22.Mir Aneesuddin: And they planned a great plan.

23.Mir Aneesuddin: And they said: Do not leave your gods, nor leave Wadd, nor Suwa nor Yagus and Yauq and Nasr* *Names of false gods (deities)

24.Mir Aneesuddin: And they have misled many, and You do not (give) increase to the unjust persons in anything but error.”

25.Mir Aneesuddin: They were drowned because of their faults, then made to enter the fire, and they did not find for themselves any helpers besides Allah.

26.Mir Aneesuddin: And Nuh said, “My Fosterer! do not leave on the earth any dweller from among the infidels,

27.Mir Aneesuddin: for if you leave them they will mislead your servants and they will not give birth to any but transgressing, ungrateful (children).

28.Mir Aneesuddin: My Fosterer ! protectively forgive me and my parents and him who enters my house as a believer, and the believing men and the believing women and do not (give) increase to the unjust persons, in anything but ruin.”

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Say: It is communicated to me that a party of the jinn heard (the Quran) and said, “We have heard a wonderful Quran.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: It guides to the right way, so we have believed in it and we will never associate any partner with our Fosterer.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: And Exalted be the Majesty of our Fosterer, He has not taken a wife or a son.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: And the foolish among us used to say unjust (things) about Allah.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: And we thought that mankind and jinn never speak a lie against Allah.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: And persons from among human beings used to seek protection of persons from among the jinn so they increased them in error.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: And they (too) thought as you thought that Allah will never raise anyone (to life after death).

8.Mir Aneesuddin: And we searched the sky but found it filled with strong guards and flames.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: And we used to sit in some of the sitting places thereof to hear, but now whoever hears, he finds a flame waiting for him.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And we do not know whether evil is intended for those who are in the earth or their Fosterer intends (to guide) them to the right way.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: And among us are those who are righteous and among us (are those who are) other than that, we are sects following different traditions.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: And we know that we can neither defeat Allah in the earth nor can we defeat Him by flight.

13.Mir Aneesuddin: And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it, so whoever believes in his Fosterer, he should neither fear loss nor error.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: And among us are those who have submitted (as Muslims) and among us are those who are unjust. So those who have submitted (as Muslims) such have taken to the right way.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: And as for those who are unjust, they are the fuel for hell.”

16.Mir Aneesuddin: And if they establish (themselves) on (the right) tradition We would give them to drink abundant water

17.Mir Aneesuddin: so that We may test them thereby, and whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Fosterer He will cause him to enter severe punishment.

18.Mir Aneesuddin: And the mosques are Allah's so do not pray to anyone (else along) with Allah.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: And when the servant of Allah stood up to pray to Him they almost crowded over him.

20.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “I pray only to my Fosterer and I do not associate anyone with Him.”

21.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “I certainly do not control for you anything, wrong or right.”

22.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “None can ever protect me against Allah and I can never find besides Him, (any source of) refuge,

23.Mir Aneesuddin: (my duty is nothing) but to convey (the communications) from Allah and His messages, and whoever disobeys Allah and His messenger, then for such, there is certainly the fire , of hell, in which they will stay forever.” which they will stay forever.”

24.Mir Aneesuddin: (The infidels will not believe) till (the time) when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and lesser in number.

25.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “I do not know whether that which you are promised is nearer or whether my Fosterer has made its (time of happening) far off.”

26.Mir Aneesuddin: Knower of the unseen, but He does not reveal His unseen to anyone,

27.Mir Aneesuddin: except to a messenger whom He chooses, but He makes one who is watchful, to move before him and behind him,

28.Mir Aneesuddin: that He may know (mark out) that they have indeed conveyed the messages of their Fosterer. And He encompasses all that is with them and He computes the number of everything.

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Mir Aneesuddin: O you who are wrapped up in garments !

2.Mir Aneesuddin: Rise (to pray in) the night except a little,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: half of it or a little less than that

4.Mir Aneesuddin: or increase it and recite the Quran gradually (giving) intervals.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: We will put on you (the responsibility of delivering) a weighty statement.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: The rising at night (for righteous work) certainly gives rise to more strength of co-ordination and firmly established speech (because)

7.Mir Aneesuddin: during the day you certainly have prolonged occupation.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: And remember the name of your Fosterer and devote yourself to Him (with exclusive) devotion.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: Fosterer of the east and the west, there is no god except Him, so take Him as a Trustee.

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And be patient on what they say and keep away from them in a good (manner of) keeping away.

11.Mir Aneesuddin: And leave Me and the deniers, the possessors of favours (from Me) and give them a little time.

12.Mir Aneesuddin: Certainly, with Us are heavy fetters and hell fire

13.Mir Aneesuddin: and a food that chokes and a painful punishment.

14.Mir Aneesuddin: The day the earth will quake and the mountains (too), and the mountains will become a heap of running sand.

15.Mir Aneesuddin: We have sent to you a messenger, a witness over you, as We had sent a messenger to Firawn.

16.Mir Aneesuddin: But Firawn disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a severe seizure.

17.Mir Aneesuddin: If you reject, then how will you guard (yourselves) on the day which will make children grey headed,

18.Mir Aneesuddin: (and) on which (day) the sky will be cleft asunder ? His promise is to be fulfilled.

19.Mir Aneesuddin: This is certainly a reminder, so whoever wills, let him take a way towards his Fosterer.

9.Mir Aneesuddin: Then does he not know, that when that which is in the graves is exposed,

10.Mir Aneesuddin: and that which is in the bosoms is made to appear (i.e. secrets are revealed),

11.Mir Aneesuddin: certainly on that day, their Fosterer is fully informed about them ?

101.SurahEnglishNames: The Calamity, The Stunning Blow, The Disaster, The Terrible Calamity

1.Mir Aneesuddin: The calamity.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: What is the calamity?

3.Mir Aneesuddin: And what will make you realize what the calamity is? (It will befall on)

4.Mir Aneesuddin: the day when mankind will be like scattered moths,

5.Mir Aneesuddin: and the mountains will be like loosened wool.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: Then as for him whose weights (of good deeds) are heavy,

7.Mir Aneesuddin: then he will lead a life of pleasure.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: And as for him whose weights (of good deeds) are light,

9.Mir Aneesuddin: then his home* will be in a deep pit (of hell). * Destination

10.Mir Aneesuddin: And what will make you realize what the (deep pit of hell) is?

11.Mir Aneesuddin: (It is a) very hot fire.

102.SurahEnglishNames: Rivalry in World Increase, Competition, Worldly Gain

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Rivalry in worldly increase distracts you (from the remembrance of Allah)

2.Mir Aneesuddin: till you come to the graves.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: No, you will know.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: Again, no, you will know.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: No, if you know (having) the knowledge that is certain,

6.Mir Aneesuddin: you will definitely see hell fire.

7.Mir Aneesuddin: Then you will definitely see it with the eye of certainty.

8.Mir Aneesuddin: Then on that day you will definitely be questioned about the comforts.

103.SurahEnglishNames: The Declining Day, Eventide, The Epoch, Time

1.Mir Aneesuddin: By the time (i.e. historic time is witness that:)

2.Mir Aneesuddin: Man is certainly at a loss,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: except those who believe and do righteous works and recommend to one another, the truth, and recommend to one another, patience.

104.SurahEnglishNames: The Traducer, The Gossipmonger, The Slanderer

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Sorrowful is the state of every slanderer, defamer,

2.Mir Aneesuddin: who accumulates wealth and keeps on counting it.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: No, he will definitely be flung into the crushing one.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: And what will make you realize what the crushing one is?

6.Mir Aneesuddin: (It is the) fire of Allah, kindled,

7.Mir Aneesuddin: which is made to rise over the hearts,

8.Mir Aneesuddin: it will certainly be closed on them,

9.Mir Aneesuddin: in columns that are stretched.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Did you not consider, how your Fosterer dealt with the owners of the elephant ?

2.Mir Aneesuddin: Did He not make their plot useless,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: and send on them flocks of flying creatures,

4.Mir Aneesuddin: who pelted them with stones of baked clay,

5.Mir Aneesuddin: so that He made them like eaten up straw (husk) ?

1.Mir Aneesuddin: For the taming of Quraysh,

2.Mir Aneesuddin: their taming in equipping caravans (for traveling) in winter and summer,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: so let them serve the Fosterer of this house (Kaaba)

4.Mir Aneesuddin: Who has fed them in hunger and given them security from fear.

107.SurahEnglishNames: Small Kindnesses, Almsgiving, Have you Seen, The Daily Necessaries

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Did you see him who belies religion?

2.Mir Aneesuddin: Then he is the one who pushes away the orphan,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: and does not urge on the feeding of the poor.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: So sorrowful is the state of the worshippers

5.Mir Aneesuddin: who are heedless of their worship (salat)

6.Mir Aneesuddin: (in the sense that they are) those who make a show (of their worship)

7.Mir Aneesuddin: and refuse small kindness.

1.Mir Aneesuddin: We certainly gave you abundance,

2.Mir Aneesuddin: so worship your Fosterer and sacrifice.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: The one who hates you, he is certainly without posterity .

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “O Infidels!

2.Mir Aneesuddin: I do not serve (worship) that which you serve (worship).

3.Mir Aneesuddin: And you are not servers of that which I serve.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: And I am not a server of that which you serve.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: And you are not servers of that which I serve.

6.Mir Aneesuddin: For you your religion (or judgment) and for me my religion (or judgment).”

1.Mir Aneesuddin: When Allah's help and the victory comes,

2.Mir Aneesuddin: and you see people enter the religion of Allah in troops,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: then glorify your Fosterer by praising Him and seek His protective forgiveness. He is certainly the Accepter of repentance .

1.Mir Aneesuddin: May the hands of Abu Lahab perish. And may he perish.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: His wealth and that which he earned will not save him.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: He will enter flaming fire,

4.Mir Aneesuddin: and his wife (too who is a) carrier of fire-wood.

5.Mir Aneesuddin: In her neck (there will be) a rope of palm-fibre .

1.Mir Aneesuddin: Say, “Allah is One.

2.Mir Aneesuddin: Allah is He on Whom all depend.

3.Mir Aneesuddin: He does not beget and He is not begotten.

4.Mir Aneesuddin: And there is no one equal to Him.”

1.Mir Aneesuddin: l. Say, “I seek the protection of the Fosterer of the day break,

2.Mir Aneesuddin: from the evil of that which He has created,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: and from the evil of the darkness (of night) when it overspreads,

4.Mir Aneesuddin: and from the evil of women blowing in the knots (practicing witchcraft)

5.Mir Aneesuddin: and from the evil of the envier when he envies.”

1.Mir Aneesuddin: l. Say, “I seek the protection of the Fosterer of mankind,

2.Mir Aneesuddin: the King of mankind,

3.Mir Aneesuddin: the God of mankind,

4.Mir Aneesuddin: from the evil of the whisperings of (the devil), he who (whispers and then) withdraws,

5.Mir Aneesuddin: who whispers into the bosoms (hearts or minds) of mankind,

6.Mir Aneesuddin: from among the jinn and mankind.”
